desc.value: It's time to discuss basic combat techniques!
Memorize the strengths and weaknesses of each elements and how to trigger the Brave Burst!
Your journey as a Summoner traveling across Grand Gaia has begun! Go forth, and don't forget what Tilith taught you!
The calm grasslands keep on going.The monsters here are just right for a beginner.Keep moving forward.
You can see a rocky mountain faintly on the horizon. Tilith is waiting at the "Cave of Flames" just beyond here.
The magma flowing within this cave gives off an intense heat. The enemies in this cave have the power of fire.
Continue deeper into the Cave of Flames. Beings who control fire are waiting ahead.
You've come far, but there's still no exit in site. There are supposed to be bandits in this area.
Looks like you'll be able to leave this cave soon, but there seems to be something sinister awaiting you at the end.
You've emerged into a blizzard. It's so cold, watch out for enemies with water attacks.
You are making progress, but the end of the snowscape still isn't visible. Don't forget to plan for water enemies.
You've reached the center of the icy field. Beware, apparently there are pirates about on the ice...
The end of this cold snow field has come into view at last. However, it seems one of Maxwell's knights is waiting just ahead.
Beyond the snow lie the forests that the sun doesn't reach. Beware, there are signs of monsters are all around.
This monster-packed forest just goes on forever. Everything's the same, seems like you're walking in circles...
It's said that bandits occupy this forest. They may be tough, but there's no way to avoid them.
Dangerous hunters wielding longbows inhabit the depths of this forest, and they attack anyone who dares enter.
Lightning occasionally roars throughout this damp land. It's quite unpleasant here. Prepare yourself for thunder.
It looks to be a vast wetland. The terrain may prove more troublesome than the thunder-wielding enemies hiding in it.
Seems there are bandits around here, too. They used to call the skies their own, but what strength that must've taken...
At the end of these unpleasant wetlands the way is blocked by a former hero of Grand Gaia who was summoned by Maxwell.
These ancient ruins have a solemn, holy air. It's much better than where you were before, but it's still ominous.
It appears that a sage with the power of light is in the ruins. A guardian, perhaps?
A shining, gallant white horse blocks the path. It defends its position, attacking mercilessly.
A warrior of light lies in wait in the depths of these ruins, testing adventurers before they're allowed to pass.
This spine-chillingly eerie mansion reeks of an evil presence. Here you'll need the power to oppose darkness.
Light energy is strong against dark, but it's also its weakness. You must plan your strategy here carefully.
A monster with snakes for arms has appeared. Beware, it seems many adventurers have been subdued by its strength.
A grotesque swordsman awaits you, and you must overcome him in order to reach the Tower of Mistral.
You've reached the Tower of Mistral at last. This is Maxwell's base inside Mistral. Hurry your way inside!
This tower reaches amazingly high into the sky. Fearsome monsters await with blood-soaked claws.
Halfway up, a giant flying dragon is defends the tower, attacking anyone who nears. You must avoid it's attacks to advance.
Masters of each of the four elements stand in wait as the final barrier in the path to the lord of the tower.
You're almost at the top. A mechanical deity, likely Maxwell's creation, awaits. The final battle for Mistral begins.
There is a mountain range at the end of the Egor Plains where it is said an evil god who once destroyed several small nations slumbers.
Your journey through Morgan begins in a huge desert. The scorching haze indicates the fierce battle to come.
The bandits in this burning desert have much stronger resolve that those in Mistral, and it seems they intend to block your way.
A summoned being known as the king of beasts is rampaging in the desert. A fierce battle with him is unavoidable.
You've reached the desert's mid point. An incarnation of flames blocks the way, further scorching the land around it.
The end of the desert is in view, and the wind now smells of the sea. However, a giant silhouette stands blocks your path...
You've reached the shore, escaping the desert. A calm, beautiful beach awaits you, but you must still be cautious.
A huge ship is anchored on the beach. It's a pirate ship, and it seems there's no easy way past...
The beautiful view continues, as do the number of enemies you encounter. Prepare yourself for a water assault.
The end of the coastline is now in view. A Water Spirit is said to appear around here. How strong could it be?
You've finally reached the coast's end. A dark forest is visible ahead, but surely something is lurking near...
Your eyes haven't adjusted to the dark since coming in from the coast. Are Karl and the others OK?
Dark forests like this are usually full of bandits. Is it that they work better in the Dark? Either way, be careful.
The discomfort you felt in the forests of Mistral is back, but this time it's worse. Could this be the work of a time mage?
It's hard telling which trees are just trees and not just monsters in hiding. If only you could escape this forest...
The darkness has lightened. The exit should be close, but there's tension in the air. Surely, the sign of a formidable foe.
After escaping the pitch black forest, you entered a vast wasteland. The area is being torn apart by lightning.
You move forward as lightning strikes down all around you. Beware of incoming aerial attacks.
You're nearing the center of the wastelands. Did Karl and his team successfully bring down the demon they were chasing?
There's a temple barely visible in the distance. There's no sign of Karl, what has happened to him...
A summoned thunder king is blocking the path at the end of the wasteland. You must defeat him before continuing.
There is a temple bathed in light. Despite it being thousands of years old, it's as beautiful as the day it was built.
You continue even deeper into the massive temple. You can make out the solemn silhouettes of pegasi standing about.
You've nearly reached the middle of the temple. You can imagine the days when many would gather at this impressive alter.
You can feel the enemies growing stronger the deeper you go. Unfortunately, the only way to the Tower of Morgan is forward.
You reached the temple's innermost area. A mighty swordsman awaits you, and you can surely expect a fierce battle...
You see ruins as you escape from the temple. It seems that whatever existed here before was destroyed by a great power.
As you proceed, you realize the ruins cover a large area. It must have been a large city before.
You've come to a plaza in the middle of the ruins. An enormous church embodies the former power of this devastated city.
Leaving the church, you continue through the ruins. The temple was so beautifully preserved, what could've happened here?
You reached the ruins' end. The majestic Tower of Morgan stands before you. However, a knight in thick armor awaits...
Don't let Karl and Seria's wishes go to waste. Ascend the tower quickly and track down Abaddon and Graham!
This tower is like a gigantic fortress. The spiral stairs that surround its vast outer walls are the only way up...
Is this only the halfway point? You can still hear the cries from the fierce battle raging below... It's time to hurry.
Past the halfway point, warriors summoned by Maxwell and Abaddon block the path. There's no turning back now.
The Stairway to the Heavens has narrowed. You can no longer hear the shouts from the base. You're almost there.
You've reached the top at last. Continue on and defeat Abaddon and Graham, you can't let Karl and the others down!
You're now in Maxwell's stronghold, St. Lamia. Many tall mountains are visible in the distance. The land looks rugged.
Magma is gushing out all over, and it's scorching hot as far as the eye can see. Nothing could possibly live here.
It's getting hotter and hotter as you near the mouth of the volcano. It's getting hard to even move...
You finally made it through the pass. The intense heat hasn't gone, but at least it's all downhill from here. Hurry on ahead.
Just as you were about to escape the volcano, it seems an undead beast is blocking your path...
You've emerged from the base of a mountain. Now it's intensely cold, and it seems to be taking its toll on Tilith.
Unlike the Volcano Eldent, this blizzard-covered sacred mountain has many steep cliffs. Watch your step.
This place is also inhabitable. It's doubtful anyone could even last a minute around here. Hurry on ahead.
Around the summit, stones are stacked in a alter-like pattern. Is this proof that the mountain was a place of worship?
The summit is in sight, and you've spotted the altar. The end is near, but there are signs of a beast nearby...
Beyond the sacred mountain lies the Blood Forest. Tilith is acting a bit odd, though, she might be sick...
A sea of red surrounds you as you walk through this forest. The grass, the flowers, everythings red. What's the meaning of this?
You continue deeper into the crimson forest. Suddenly, drops as red as blood fall down on you from the trees above.
You feel your senses numbing as you're enveloped in a sea of red. It's probably not a good idea to stick around here.
You've finally reached the end of the crimson forest. You see a color other than red and race towards it.
You're halfway through St. Lamia, and Tilith's deteriorating condition has worsened. It's time to hurry.
Mt. Wistorea is the steepest in the area, but its calm weather makes it the most comfortable environment so far.
Hold off the hordes of giants as you move forward. You can't waste time with Tilith's current condition.
The Thunderbird circles above, letting out a piercing cry. You've no choice but to confront it and take it down.
You can make out St. Lamia Palace in the distance, but the roar of a beast from the foothills nearby are concerning...
You come across a clearing bathed in a dazzling light, but as Tilith's curse is growing stronger there is no time to enjoy it.
This area is obviously sacred, bathed in light and covered in green, but being so close to St. Lamia Palace surely strong foes await.
Without provocation, hordes of shining demons swoop down on you. These demons must've been called upon by Maxwell...
Seems even a holy goddess has been called on to block your path. However, you must defeat her and press on if you're to save Tilith.
The exit is in sight, but a giant entity can be seen swooping down from the heavens, possibly to deliver your final trial...
In a complete change of scenery, you come across a dark, rancid cave. Pass through this, and St. Lamia Palace awaits.
This cave not only looks horrid, but is also full to the brim with fearsome beings. You mustn't lose focus here or else.
There is a nagging chill in the air, though it isn't necessarily cold. Could it be this malicious air that surrounds you?
It seems you've reached the dark, damp reaches of this hellish cave. Follow the wind to find your way out.
You seem to have finally figured your way out of the cave, but all of the sudden an unsettling evil presence descends upon you...
You've finally reached Maxwell's stronghold. You continue forward, having vowed to Tilith to destroy this depraved god.
This castle once was revered for its majesty. While still impressive, it's surrounded in a sinister atmosphere.
As expected, Maxwell has filled her base with incredibly powerful beings. Liberating them is going to be difficult.
You've entered the castle's banquet hall. The sacred walls reek of wickedness, but you mustn't hesitate. Advance, for Tilith!
You can feel the fallen god's presence grow stronger as you proceed. However, surely she has set up a powerful defensive line before her.
At last, you've reached Maxwell. The battle to save Tilith and destroy the first of the four fallen gods begins now...
Amdahl, one of the islands in the Palmyna Archipelago which is ruled over by Cardes the Malevolent. A town can be seen near the entrance, having been devastated by war.
Past the damaged houses lies nothing but fiery ruins. Could these flames be the work of monsters?
You can feel the flames growing stronger. This might be a sign that something dangerous is waiting ahead.
When lightning strikes it sometimes ignites the earth where it hits. The force that controls the lightning and flames has set their aim on you.
A figure watches you from the shadows as you attempt to leave the village. It seems all the intense fighting has attracted the attention of a fire god.
Monsters snarl in unison as they scheme to make you their main dish at this ghost ship party.
What could be waiting unbeknownst to history in this ship that appeared so long ago? You can't deny your curiosity.
You can hear a water dragon's roar even from inside the ship. Is this howl meant to get rid of those who disturb the souls of the dead crew members?
As you try to escape the ghost ship to investigate, a frigid swordsman appears before you, along with his sword techniques which can turn anything to ice.
It seems you must leave Amdahl if you are to defeat Cardes, but before that you need to escape the ghost ship.
You stop in a field, surprised by a mysterious man who now blocks your path. There's no time to loiter, you need to shake your fear and push ahead.
On your way toward Amdahl Castle, an incredibly graceful figure appears before you. Vanquish it and move ahead.
You've come to a prairie covered in trees and shrubs, but what is that lurking in the shadows, seemingly ready to strike...
Nearing a pond at the edge of the prairie, some Water Nymphs stand in your way as if they're protecting something. What could it be?
On your way from the prairie, someone has been sent to block your path. Carefully proceed forward.
After parting with Karl and Seria you proceed through the mines. Making your way through the monster infested tunnels, you come across a decaying bridge.
It seems the demon Graham who escaped from Mistral has shown up around here. Could this strong presence coming from ahead be him? Or maybe...
Continuing through the mines, you occasionally hear the sound of thunder. Whether it's natural or the roar of some thunder beast, surely you'll find out soon.
The center of the mine is full of traps. Blades are also quickly flashing about. Eliminate those who stand in your way and advance!
A sanctuary can be seen shining just beyond the mine. The exit seems to be within reach. All you have to do is defeat the enemies before you.
According to a mysterious old man, this sanctuary holds information on the Four Heroes of Old. Take a quick detour and check it out.
A warrior carrying a massive sword appears before you as you're searching for information on the Four Heroes. He swings at you as he approaches.
The sunlight shining on the sanctuary is as pleasant as Tilith said it would be, but who is this coming in to bathe in the light the same as she would have...
A gunshot suddenly echoes through the solemn sanctuary interior. As startled as you are, you see a shining marksman before you.
There doesn't seem to be any particularly important information in the sanctuary. It's time to end your detour and set your sites back on Amdahl Castle.
According to Karl and Seria, Graham has already left this place. However, you should still be cautious as you proceed.
The remains of a city thought to have at one time prided itself on its extravagance. It seems someone is controlling the spirits who would otherwise be at rest here.
Your senses suddenly heighten. Could it be this intense blood-thirsty presence you feel up ahead? It's already too late to turn back.
You pick up an item while advancing through the destroyed city. It's a powerful magic barrier, the likes of which have never been seen.
As you exit Edila you're able to see the entrance to Amdahl Castle, but suddenly, a figure consumed by darkness blocks your way forward.
Amdahl Castle, where vengeful ghosts of the past are said to reside. Through here is the only way to get to Palmyna, the land sealed away by Cardes the Malevolent.
According to Elder Grah, a vengeful ghost that resents humans lives here. Still, you mustn't lose your way, even if only to prevent yourself from becoming a ghost as well.
The beautifully decorated interior of the castle suggests that at one time many an extravagant banquet was held here. But all relics aside, it's time to head further inside.
There is light and darkness wherever you go. But still, where did the darkness in the Amdahl Empire come from? There's probably no longer anyone around that knows.
The end of Amdahl, the first island in the Palmyna Archipelago, is within sight. However, there are still some rather troublesome enemies about...
You sense a strikingly ominous presence coming from the path ahead. What awaits you isn't a god like before, but some being with a strong resentment toward humans.
Encervis, the second island in the Palmyna Archipelago. You first come across its scorching hot volcanic ash covered hills.
As you head toward Cardes, your way is blocked by nymphs and dragons that command the power of fire. Their presence is like that of an overwhelming pillar of flames.
You can hear the cry of not one beast but many coming from the fiery hills. Who could possibly command such fearful roars?
Fire has both the power to incinerate everything and to restore life. Harnessing these powers, fallen gods continue to roam these lands as they always have.
As you cross over the ash stained hills, a figure blanketed in black flames appears before you. A smile comes across your face, delighted to have come across such a warrior.
You cross over the ash covered hills to find a beautiful lakeside. However, before you can rest another horde of new monsters appear before you.
As you're searching the lakeside, you suddenly see a great shadow on the surface of the water. It's likely the ruler of Lake Aldela.
While gazing upon the beautiful lake, you hear a lovely singing voice. However you mustn't be seduced by it, because the being it's coming from surely isn't human.
You proceed alongside the lake, headed toward the Sky Fort. Alongside the light of the sun being reflected off the lake is the reflection of a single icy blade.
The path toward the old castle is open before you on the other side of the lake. However before you waits a sea god, wearing a fearless smile.
Now knowing how dangerous the Sky Fort really is, you must put all you have into taking it down per Elder Grah's request.
The Sky Fort is still far off. A faint magical power lingers in the pleasantly windblown air within the old castle. What could it be?
One can feel the history of Castle Avenia in all its elegance. After its original lord perished, a new royal family settled in.
Among the many remaining legendary epics, there is a tale of a young boy who saved the World Tree. Could this be what has shown itself just now?
An otherworldly warrior with some tricks up his sleeve blocks your exit from the old castle. He attacks with an indiscriminate barrage of gunfire!
There is a rumor about a monster that lives in this ravine that turns everything it sees into stone. There are few who view this widely known ghost story as being true.
As a stiff wind blows down on you from the ravine making it difficult to even stand, in an instant the sky grows dark. You look up to see something hovering above you...
You look below to see a horrifyingly deep ravine. A thunderous roar can be heard from deep beneath. A single massive eye peeks at you.
Two beasts block your path forward through the Gadillian Ravine. One has an enormous body, while the other is a wild and beastly warrior.
In this harshly windblown wasteland exists a lone warrior whose solitary lifestyle aptly befits their surroundings.
Karl and Seria, will those two be able to fight their way out of this predicament? There's no time to worry as a monster with a taste for mischief appears before you.
There is a solemn atmosphere in the mausoleum where the natives pray to their god of light. However, there isn't enough time to investigate this supposed god any further...
You progress through the Alman Mausoleum, keeping your eye on the Sky Fort. Sensing a strong presence, you turn to find a warrior waving a large sword.
One's belonging to the light is not set in stone. This is because one can never be fully clear that their principles are just. One must prove their righteousness with their blade.
What could that knight be thinking? How could anyone who fought and died for humanity's sake find themselves fighting for the gods!?
You feel the ominous presence of countless lost souls wandering about the area. What could this evil force be amidst the sorrowful howls?
A devilish presence stands before you as a hazardous obstacle in your path. Be careful not to get seduced into a vulnerable state.
Monsters rush at you as if under some sort of spell. This appears to be a challenge from one who possesses power that transcends even death.
Resentment is one of the strongest emotions people have. Though it can sometimes be used as a motivating force to accomplish a goal, there are few who desire it.
You look up to see the Sky Fort! Have faith in Tilith and push your way through this final obstacle!
Escape the Sky Fort for the sake of the wounded Tilith and those who stand guard over her! Mow down any who stand in your way!
Hordes of monsters are blocking your path. Defeat them all as you advance forth! You've nearly made your way to Zebra!
The monsters' aggression grows stronger as if they're trying to buy time for Zebra to recover from the wounds he was dealt during his battle with Tilith.
Your enemies' aggression continues to grow, but as long as your comrades are behind you there's no choice but to fight your way forth.
You're reached the deepest reaches of the Sky Fort. Zebra is close at hand, but your way is blocked by what were some of the greatest warriors to have ever lived.
Powerful enough to surpass even a goddess, the demonic Zebra is waiting just ahead. Strengthen your will as preparedness may become a vital weapon in the end.
Mysterious ruins were discovered in Encervis. It seems that a fiendish apparition haunts the place...
Your sights now rest on Cardes, one of the Four Fallen Gods. However the path ahead is scorching hot due to the blistering hot sun above.
You've arrived at the increadibly hot Dejour Ruins. Monsters trapped in the red hot winds block your way forth.
A man-eating demon and an ancient dragon wrapped in flames block the path toward Obselion Castle where Tilith awaits you.
Thirst and hunger line the scorching path ahead. In the steamy distance awaits a chef unmoved by the heat. What ingredients could she be looking for?
Two warriors, locked in combat since long ago, take a break from their intense fighting to block your way forward.
The royal family of Palmyna once resided in this magnificent castle. It's beautifully frozen corridors now give off a feeling of sadness.
The castle grounds are silent, and Tilith is nowhere to be found. There's nothing but frozen hallways leading in each direction.
A brisk wind blows upon you as you continue investigating the castle grounds.  The cool breeze feels like an invitation to death...
You couldn't find Tilith, but just as Grahdens said, you must put your faith in her and move forth. Your goal is to defeat Cardes.
As you try to escape the castle, you come to a giant wall of ice. Worse than that, two daunting warriors are lying in wait for you.
After parting from Seria and Karl, you head toward the place where Cardes is sealed away, vanquishing enemies who appear from the silent forest.
All manner of beasts try and stand in your way as you work towards the Spirit World, the land where Cardes is sealed away...
It's been countless years since the last of the humans died out, but still the forest doesn't sleep. It seems it has thrived in their absence.
Proceeding along a lightly foggy path, you come across the rulers of the forest. The ruler of trees and the master of fairies now stand before you.
Those with great power are often overcome by it. However, legend speaks of one mighty warrior who succeeded in gaining control.
Grandelt was once the most vibrant city in Palmyna, but it has since turned into a ghost town. Lined with abandoned buildings, it now stands in ruins.
Tilith injured herself investigating how to get to the Spirit World. You must repay her by making your way to Cardes!
You're now headed for the Noera Battlegrounds. However, the sky suddenly turns black as you look up to see a massive figure above.
Escaping between the rows of crumbling buildings, you're jolted by a sudden tremor. Could this be Gaia's rage? Or maybe...
The Heroes of Old longed for the life of a lone warrior, and if ever two of such warriors should meet their joy would rain down like lightning.
Grahdens's question planted a seed in its wake. However this is no time to get distracted. You must repay the goddess's favor.
Many students with bright futures ahead of them once studied here. The presence awaiting you in this sacred place is one clad in light.
Lorand, one of the Heroes of Old. The place where he once taught as a professor has now been overtaken by dangerous monsters.
A brightly shining gun-wielding warrior stands before you. You must fight against this force which threatens to rip away your very soul.
The atmosphere is ominously heavy in this solemn seminary. Maintain focus and keep moving forward.
Despite the rumors they were the strongest around, those two never crossed swords. Perhaps they understood what it really meant to be strong.
This place once hosted a battle between humans and the gods. Even after many years, it still bears the scars of those days.
A spirit possessed by the thrill of battle, and the one who pursues it. As long as their fight continues, they will never disappear.
These grounds are haunted by those who couldn't be saved. It serves no purpose other than to create further casualties.
The entrance to the Spirit World is now within view. All that's left is to believe in Tilith's words and move forth, knocking away any who get in your way.
You come across an unending battle, where man and brute fight over who gets to lay claim to the other's soul.
You're now at the entrance to the Spirit World, but your way is blocked by two dark soldiers. Overflowing with power, their eyes brim with madness.
You've all made your way to the Spirit World. Now you must put your heads together to defeat Cardes, and then get back together safely.
The air is ominous where a Fallen God was once sealed away. You can feel the presence of enemies exponentially more powerful than any you've seen before.
The Spirit World grows unstable as the seal nears its breaking point. Uncertain of where Cardes may be, you must believe in your comrades and move forth!
Just as Tilith said, the seal is nearly broken. As you wonder how you should deal with it, hordes of crazed monsters are looking to prey on you.
The unstable seal reveals a being of dark and light from within it. However, an unexpected opponent has set their sights on you!
You feel a wicked pulse coming from deep within the Spirit World, but before you can reach it you must defeat a once legendary hero.
The path to Cardes is now open. Now's your chance to put an end to him, and once again show your power over the gods!
A new investigation has begun into the land of Lizeria. The path to the once thriving La Veda Republic lies open, covered in weeds as it may be.
The crumbling paved road stretches forth, though there are no signs that humans ever lived in this area. Be cautious as you proceed.
How many years have passed since someone last walked this path? Surely this was a beautiful road back when it was taken care of.
If you look closely it is obvious this road wasn't made this way by nature alone. It seems a great battle took place in this area.
The enemies attack quite aggressively. It's as if they're determined to keep anyone from setting foot inside the old capital.
The end of the road is in sight. However, as you advance the monsters only grow in numbers. You must maintain focus as you move ahead.
Entering the mountains the sky grows dark. Could it be because of the smoke rising up from the volcanic ash? Dead trees line the path ahead.
Though not hot enough to burn the skin, the air here is hot. In addition, it is also very thin. Do your best to retain consciousness.
No matter where you look there's nothing but dried up trees, ash, and rocks. This place has no hopes of ever seeing water. You must get out of hear quickly.
There are now a lot of paths leading out. It looks like you'll be able to escape the mountains soon, however, you can feel something ahead, the presence of a strong enemy.
The air is dry as always, but it's getting harder and harder to breath. After a short break, an intense roar echoes from afar.
Before you lies a frozen lake. It seems the only way to get to the beach on the other side is to cross over it. Be careful as you proceed forth.
It is dry here as well, but for a different reason than it was up in the mountains. It's impossible to stand still in this cold. Could Lugina really be waiting here?
Step after shaky step, you cross the surface of the frozen lake. Looking back, you realize you've made it exactly halfway. How long will the ice hold?
A chilling wind blows across the lake. Attempting to shrug off the piercing cold, the temperature around you drops unnaturally. What could it be?
The shore is in view, you can finally get off the ice. Hurry up and get to the shore where there's no chance of slipping.
You've come to an odd smelling marshland. A strange fog hangs above the water's bubbling bottomless surface. There's no use sticking around here any longer.
A stomach-turning stench fills the moist humid air. Even when the bad smell breaks, you're left with the choking fragrance of vegetation.
Monsters leap in attack from both the muddied water as well as the thick shrubs. You'd like to catch your breath, but it seems there's nowhere to rest.
Suddenly, the miasma from the bog disappears. The air which was once difficult to breath is now fresh and clean. This is likely cause for concern.
You've made it a long way down the muddy path. The end of the marsh is near, but a remarkably large tree stands in front of you. Surely it isn't an ordinary tree.
Deep black storm clouds fill the sky. Lightning falls in endless waves upon the forest below. There's no way anything could live here.
Your ears begin ringing as lightning endlessly crashes down. The air is thick with the odor of a burnt tree which has been struck by lightning.
The trees here seem able to withstand exposure to lightning. However, in noticing this it seems you have become lost.
A paralyzing presence inhabits the forest. You recognize this aura. It seems a warrior you've faced before awaits you once again.
The sky has become brighter. It seems you might soon be able to escape this strange weather. Is Lugina waiting ahead like he said he'd be?
You've arrived at the ruins of the La Veda Republic. As ravaged as it is, there are still traces in the rubble of the people who used to live here.
You notice elaborate carvings in the pieces of stone around your feet. The powderized remains of buildings speak of the violent battle that took place here.
Despite how desolate these ruins are, there are no signs of weapons or human remains, and the air is fresh and clean.
Continuing your search of the ruins, an overwhelming presence stops you in your tracks. Up ahead, a knight of the La Veda Republic lies in wait.
Burnt houses, crumbling churches. There must've been many residents in a city as large as this. You can't help but hope that the victims have found peace.
Paris said there should be a shrine dedicated to the God of Light around here. A great force stands before you as if to protect the souls of those betrayed by the gods.
Arriving at the outskirts of the city you see a shockingly massive bridge. Before you can get to it you must confront the huge dragon on your tail.
Now that you stand near the bridge it looks a lot bigger than it seamed from far away. You can see an ominous tower far in the distance, but could that be the end?
Turning back, you see the ruins. Compared to that desolate yet pure place, the bridge is soaked in an ominous miasma. What could be waiting ahead?
The closer you get to the tower, the more hightened your fear becomes. It's as if the tower itself was infused with some sort of evil energy.
You've finally made it to the bridge's halfway point. As the enemies are growing stronger, it seems fighting through the second half will only be more difficult.
Enemies continue attacking, allowing no room for rest. Could they be protecting the power that Paris said was hidden here?
You're close enough to the tower that you have to look up to see where it ends. It's odd appearance causes a lump in your throught.
Not much longer to the tower. Lugina still hasn't shown up yet so it's highly likely he's waiting somewhere around here. Proceed with caution.
There is a thick steel door at the entrance to the tower. Although it is open, you must defeat the monsters around you before going inside.
Entering inside you notice the entire tower is slightly trembling. You must shake off this bad feeling and focus on the enemy in front of you.
It's a long way to the top, and on top of that there are even more enemies here than outside. What Paris said now stirs uneasiness within you.
The tower's shaking has grown stronger. The oppressive rythmic sound bears heavily on your chest. What is it that Paris saw here?
What floor is this? Suddenly looking outside, the once massive bridge now looks relatively small. The top is near, prepare yourself and move forth.
This could be the final floor. However, you feel the presence of the Four Heroes coming from behind the door leading to the roof. You must defeat them to advance.
You can hear a ghastly noise coming from the roof. It's the final gate protecting Lizeria's hidden power. Muster your courage and go forth.
You can feel the immense energy coming from the depths of the lake. But for what purpose does it continue to radiate the surface?
A thick fog hangs around you as the light stench of rotten eggs fills the air. Be careful as it would all be over if you fell in the hole from which the steam pours.
It's like a steam bath here, the hot steam making it hard to breathe. It'd be difficult to wear armor travelling through a place like this.
It's hot. Some cold water would be nice, but there's nothing here but boiling water. You're drenched in sweat, might as well wash off while you're here.
Pushing aside the steamy air, a scorching hot wind blows in. The parched air instantly dries your once sweat covered body.
A wind blows in from outside. It's fresh feel invigorates you. However, you sense a powerful thirst coming from where the wind is blowing. It's likely a strong foe.
All you see goes from steam to snow, and your once steaming hot body is instantly cooled. Worried about Karl, you continue after him.
Before you notice, your once wet hair and clothes are frozen. Surely you'll catch a cold in this radically changing weather. Brush away the frost and hurry ahead.
The sprawling snowscape before you is gorgeous, but as much as you'd like to stare this isn't the time to get distracted. You must catch up to Karl.
You notice that the softly falling snow is starting to cover Karl's tracks. You must find him before you lose trace of him.
As you traverse the whitewashed landscape, you're surprised by a firm, icy sound. It's the echo of icy gunfire headed your way!
Plants that you've never seen before flourish everywhere. Smash your way through this overflowingly vibrant forest just as Seria would expect you to.
It's hot and humid in this dark forest. It's not as hot here as it was in that steamy cavern, but you're already beginning to sweat.
Various strange flowers bloom proudly around you. Their mixing smells produce a strange aroma. It's almost...intoxicating...
From far away you thought you saw a large tree, but now it seems to be coming toward you. Is this an illusion, or is the tree really moving?
As sunlight begins to peek into the forest, it seems you might be able to get out. Karl and Seria are in the ruins ahead. You must hurry to them.
You must escape the ruins to get to the tower where Karl is being held. Tilith can take care of Seria, so hurry ahead as fast as you can.
The ruins are quite old, but magic still illuminates the area. What's strange, however, is that it isn't fire, but the power of thunder magic which is being used.
As rough as the inside of the ruins is, they still seem to be intact. There also don't appear to be any traps to protect from intruders, but still...
It seems these ruins were once used as a fortress. There are armories lined with spears, though each one of them is covered with rust.
You sense a strong enemy near the exit to the ruins. Zevalhua's disciple Mare was able to read Seria's movements in attacking her. Be careful.
A wind gently blows through the soft sunlight. Exiting the ruins, you seem to be on the side of a mountain. The sky is clear and the weather is pleasant.
Could this path also be part of the ruins? The moss covered path and crumbling statues show show the passage of time. Still, this is no time to relax.
The air is invigorating here. It'd be nice to stop here and take a deep breath. The view is so beautiful, maybe you can return here after Karl is rescued.
The mountain path slowly turns downhill. As your trip around this beautiful mountain comes to an end you almost feel sad, but you must hurry forward.
The cave is wide open before you. You should be able to get to the tower through here. You'd better prepare yourself for surprise attacks.
Entering the cave from the bright mountain path, your eyes have yet to adjust. Despite the dim light, the cave is considerably dark.
Why was Karl kidnapped? Mare said she wished to show him the truth, but still...Karl is your closest friend. You must save him.
Thanks to the torch you can see ahead of you, but the ground is still dark. The flickering torch seems to make the darkness appear thicker.
The stench of death wafts through the air from the deep darkness. Where could this cave lead? This darkness is really unsettling.
A pungent rusty metal odor pours into your nose. It's the smell of blood! The exit ought to be near, but there's no doubt something dreadful is waiting ahead.
Running alongside a white wall, you chase after the dragon that injured Tilith. Following its trail should lead you to where Karl is.
There's a sturdy tower intricately built from white stones. From its appearance, it looks like it was built as a military fortress, but it feels creepy.
Hurry up the ivory stone steps. Who knows what kind of traps Mare set up ahead. Aim for the top, and proceed calmly, but quickly.
Is Karl all right? Just as Tilith said, there must be a reason why Karl is being kept alive, so his life shouldn't be in danger, but still...
The enemy's attacks have gotten stronger. Perhaps you're nearing the top. With this much resistance, it must mean that Karl is ahead!
A sudden surge of blood curdling power seeping down from the floor above stops you in your tracks. Prepare yourself and head up to where your two foes await.
The top level of the white tower. The dragon slowly turns its gaze to you, and lets out a deafening roar. You have to defeat it and save Karl!
The city is enormous, befitting the once prosperous capital of an empire. Though it's smaller than Randall, make sure you don't get lost.
Every building in the city looks plain yet sturdy. The fact that they've survived the ravages of war is testament to their expert craftsmanship.
Lugina told your enemies to do their worst, but they are fiercer than you anticipated. Their spirit of kinship and heroism permeates the air.
You are still surprised that Lugina is cooperating in Karl's rescue. Though his words suggest otherwise, he isn't such a bad person.
You have reached the opposite gate. Though there are no signs of Mare, you can sense a sinister heat approaching.
The beach is peppered with Lugina's footprints. He warned you not to follow him, but you have no choice. You proceed along the shoreline.
The comfortable sea breeze is a perfect complement to the sun's strong rays. But you don't have time to enjoy it and must keep searching for where Karl is being held.
Though walking along the shore reminds you of your time with Tilith back at Morgan, there is no time for reminiscing. Brace yourself and press ahead.
Unlike the weather, the sandy terrain is less than ideal for combat. Walking so far from the city has also exhausted you.
As you approach the end of the beach, the sand turns to mud. If experience has taught you anything, something formidable should be waiting ahead.
Mare the demon is a master of deception. Her last words may be a ruse. However, her next attack could be imminent.
An exquisite view fills your eyes, of geological formations you have never seen. Use extra caution as you proceed.
You cannot rely on Lugina against Mare's tricks. Though you want to preserve your energy for your solo fight, the enemies' attacks just get fiercer.
You worry about Karl's safety in the hands of Mare. However, now is the time to hurry ahead, not to think ominous thoughts about your friend.
The terrain here is not as rough. Perhaps this is where Mare will strike. Prepare yourself for her attack.
Dark clouds drape the sky above, punctuated by incessant lightning that racks your nerves. You must sneak past carefully, ready for Mare's next attack.
The placement of enemies is no accident. They were planted with great precision to wear you down, serving you up on a platter for Mare.
The enemies' vicious attacks are taking their toll. However, this is hardly the place to catch your breath, for Karl's life is in your hands.
Mare's strategy must be working exactly as planned. Almost completely worn out, you are practically a sitting duck for her.
The ominous clouds begin to clear, a sign that you may have made it out of your crisis. Yet taking a break now would be most dangerous.
Perhaps Mare is afraid of the power some humans wield. That would explain her incessant attempts to wear you down.
The air wafting through the tomb seems fresh and clean. Judging by the inscriptions on the wall, this place dates back to the Agni Empire.
Fighting your enemies here makes you feel like a tomb raider. There don't seem to be too many booby-traps set in the tomb, but be careful.
Continuing this solo battle is both physically and emotionally taxing. Try not to worry about Karl, or you'll play right into Mare's hands.
A salty breeze wafts through the tomb, hinting at where it extends. Perhaps Karl is being held there.
Seria is as reckless as always. You worry about her wounds but can't stop now. You thank her for her impeccable timing and proceed onward.
The cave connected to the tomb seems to extend even further below the sea. The damp air makes you shiver as it tickles the back of your neck.
The cave is even darker than the pitch black seafloor above it. Because of this, creatures of the dark have free reign.
The stench of death that fills the cave twists your imagination in an ominous way. However, you pray that Lugina is able to rescue Karl.
Somehow, the cave exhibits signs of human civilization. Could there be manmade structures this far below the sea?
You must properly thank Lugina later for securing Karl's safety. Being Mare's prisoner must not have been a cakewalk.
Your exhaustion from the journey to rescue Karl has worn off. Perhaps the strong human bond between you that Mare loves to mock has its benefits.
The shrine at the bottom of the ocean has a confusing, unearthly aura. The fact that Lugina was able to find Karl here is impressive.
Rescuing Karl surely threw a wrench into Mare's plans. If you can attack her head-on and avoid her trickery, you have quite a fighting chance.
The enemy attacks increase further in ferocity. But their primitive, brute force approach is evidence that you are hot on Mare's tail.
You have reached the innermost area of the shrine. You will have to defeat the remaining enemies here before you flush Mare out, but do not worry: you are not alone.
At last you have found Mare in a room at the back of the altar. Show her that she is no match for the human bond you share with your friends.
It is said a ghastly spirit is sealed away deep within this gloomy dungeon home to dark secrets left from the Agni Empire.
A world of inferno awaits you as you proceed further into the dark cave. The molten lava glows brightly, but behind it lies a sinister darkness.
Who knows how long the simmering lava has been waiting in this cave for its chance to rise to the surface. Soon its pressure will force it out.
This land is said to inspire the spirit of warfare in its inhabitants. Judging from the enemies standing in your way, this seems to be true.
The scalding lava plunges at you all of a sudden. If it hits you, you'll suffer far more than fourth degree burns. However, worse dangers lie ahead...
A hero wielding a sword of fire waits ahead. You must somehow sneak past the mix of holy and unholy flames and make it out of the cave.
Frozen winds rush at you. The fact that the black cave of molten lava exists so close to this snowfield reminds you that nature is a force to be reckoned with.
You take a peek in all directions and are met with stark whiteness. Try not to lose your sense of direction. Follow the sparse trees and the sun's movements.
Just as with Karl, you have faith that Grahdens is safe. But your loss of words to console Karl is regrettable.
You sense a sudden drop in temperature around you. Judging from experience, this means danger is not far off.
A wielder of ice magic carrying a terrifying axe stands in your way. A fierce battle is about to start, but make it quick. The snowfield's exit is near.
The verdant ocean of trees lives up to its name. Wherever you look, the sun's rays are blocked by lush greenery. Under your feet, the ground is covered in grass and moss.
Unlike the tundra, the forest is full of what looks like landmarks. But they are starting to lead you astray as you trip over the thick grass.
All of a sudden, sunshine bathes you as the old growth gives way to young foliage. The fresh flowers are a pleasure to your senses.
You happen upon an old tree that manages to stand out in the ocean of its peers. Though not much taller than the others, it is far wider. You must make your way around it.
Further into the ocean of trees you see some covered in exquisite flowers. Their petals rain down as the armored princess and gunner from another world approach.
Leave Lugina and Seria to their own devices for now. Around this bog are the lingering traces of civilization, as if it was once someone's home.
Rain pours down with incessant lightning. Just as you start to suspect that enemies lurk here, an ambush strikes from above!
You proceed around the outskirts of the bog as the rain drenches you. The enemy attacks are as relentless as the storm, taking their toll on your stamina.
The cacophony of thunder threatens to burst your eardrums. Each time the lightning strikes, so do your enemies' swords, raising the hair on the back of your soaked neck.
You reach the opposite end of the marsh. It doesn't seem like Grahdens is being held anywhere around here. Proceed to the sea.
The sun starts to dye the sky a blood orange hue. Though you can't see the tower Tilith spoke of, it mustn't be far. Keep going.
Mare's abduction of Karl was an act of suicide. But why would Zevalhua take Grahdens captive?
The sea breeze feels comfortable against your skin, as does the sunlight coming from your left. But do not let your guard down.
The rocky stretch under took some getting used to. But now that you have your feet planted, it's the perfect fighting ground.
At this time of day, you must pay attention to your position in battle. When your enemies stand between you and the sun, their movements are hard to read.
You avoided the god of destruction, but now you must face the warrior with eight blades on her back. This is a crucial stage--your enemies have no plans to rest.
These ruins were once the capital of Agni, known as Mirvana. Exposed to the worst of warfare, the city still bears its scars.
At time there are cracks in the darkness that appear to bones. Your ears pick up on what sounds like the woeful cries of long dead soldiers.
The festering miasma in this town is not simply the remnants of warfare. You are certain that forbidden curses were used in these parts.
Judging by the dismal state of the town, the people kept fighting even after the surrounding walls were destroyed. Their determination is to be respected.
Something unusual stands before you amidst the rubble. Made of metal, it appears to be a summoned hero. Proceed slowly.
The smell of blood coming from near the gate opposite to the one you entered fills your nostrils. The tower is clos, but so is a very powerful enemy force.
You finally reach the tower atop the cape. Head for its top for your showdown against Zevalhua. Defeat the Fallen God so you can save Grahdens!
Sunlight pours into the tower, as if cheering you on. But you must have no time for such thoughts and must head upward toward your enemy.
A hero from another world is waiting for you on this floor. Though it will not be an easy fight, it should be a fair one since you made it this far.
As you climb up the stairs, you see a tremendous enemy blocking the sunlight. Make the heroes before you proud and trounce this ten-winged tormentor!
You have never felt air this thick with tension and signs of enemies nearby. Prepare yourself, for the next battle may be your last.
Everybody knows of the hero from Agni clad in flames. His reputation precedes him, like the sinister air that fills the passageway in front of you.
You have made it to the top of the tower after defeating the burning hero. But now you must do what the gods couldn't and defeat the Fallen God Zevalhua!
The air is scolding hot above the boiling lava. Despite the surroundings, Paris's expression remains cool.
The hot air burns to the touch. This is all too familiar, though, surely the fire wielding hero waits ahead.
Flames rise from the lava, robbing you of the little oxygen which remains, and the further you run ahead, the more fiery heroes block your path.
The cave ceiling is higher here. The surrounding flames are different in this area. What manner of flame waits ahead?
An overwhelming force stands in your way. Prepare yourself, as it seems the last Fallen God has sent forth the legendary Disastrous Beast.
Zurg... What could the last of the Fallen Gods be plotting. You can't help but wonder as you gaze upon the beautiful aquatic metropolis.
You can see to the bottom of the beautifully flowing river. Remembering Zurg's words, you search for a path to Vriksha.
A gorgeous palace stands in the center of town. However, the fountain in its courtyard stands frozen. Soon an ice wielding hero is upon you.
Leaving the palace alongside the river, the surface of the water suddenly explodes. The water freezes above as bullets of ice are shot your way.
You can see a massive object blocking the exit from the Sea Capital. There's no mistake, it's the legendary freezing weapon.
This forest was once home to a prosperous city, the ruins of which can be seen periodically through the undergrowth. What could've happened to it?
Though the way has been spotted with ruins, there are now none in sight. This area has likely been a simple forest since long ago.
The heroes who block your path are the same ones who once opposed the gods. Now summoned by those same gods, what could they be thinking?
Though Lugina warned you not to overthink things, you can't help but get lost in thought. Something just isn't right.
You're nearly out of the forest, but you must defeat the legendary guardian before you. Prepare yourself as you face off with the stone-like guardian.
Just past the bridge is Alnakeid Castle. You must defeat the wicked presence there to proceed to Vriksha, as far off as it may still be.
Passing the castle walls, you venture through a watch tower to find another wall. The roar of lightning around you holds the power of a massive army.
Doubt grows within you. The Four Fallen Gods should have been fighting together. What difference is there in the disputes between gods and humans?
There are now cracks to be found in the fortress walls. As unnecessary as it is, the stronghold between the three capitals still serves its purpose.
A fight awaits you at Danrard's final gate. You're greeted by an angel who once took to the sky in search of freedom.
Though it now lies in ruins, the town remains lit by a glass-sided, gravestone-like tower. The scene is quite mysterious.
Could scenes like this be commonplace in the otherworld? Also, what happened to the god who was supposed to have destroyed this town?
It seems the cave just outside the city could be your way to Alnakeid Castle. Surely, incredibly powerful foes await you there.
The lit path you walk suddenly opens up into a large plaza. You're awaited by a just swordsman and the roar of a dragon.
You spot a white figure in front of the gate leading from the town. Is it the legendary Keeper of Order? All you can do is fight your way through.
Tilith seems to be acting strange. On top of that, even Paris isn't her normal cool self. What's going on?
An oddly glowing crystal floats inside the darkened cave. Stare at it too long and you might find yourself under its spell.
As the enemy's attack reaches a whole new level, you sense a powerful force coming from deep inside the cave. Surely, a strong foe awaits.
Exhausted by all the fighting, you stop for a quick break. However, upon moving forward a chill runs down your spine. Something wicked lies ahead...
Feeling the wind, you realize you might soon be out of the cave. But before proceeding, you must first defeat a legendary demon.
Entering the hall, you're surrounded by enemies. You must defeat them before moving forward, as exhausted as you may be.
Leaving the hall, you come across a pair of foes harvesting the powers of light and dark. Defeat the minions before taking on these two.
You exit into a grand space decorated with swords. The countless scars that adorn the walls and pillars show the intense battle that took place here.
This seems to be the courtyard. It is lined with beautiful sculptures, and the pond is filled with clean water. However, enemies still lurk nearby.
Entering once again inside, your eyes spot a great fireplace glowing red. Nearby, in the dimly lit room, stands a chair made of leather.
You exit onto the castle's roof. The god Zurg spoke of should be at the top of the tower ahead. However, a hero of lightning blocks your way.
You've reached the spiral staircase inside the tower of the castle. It isn't tall, but it's full of enemies, the strongest awaiting you at the end.
It seems that Zurg's words are still bothering Tilith. Keep moving forward to bring her spirits back up, never looking back.
Though the temperature is rising, the morale of your party never wanes. Combine your powers and aim for the last Fallen God together.
The cries of the drake echo through the mountains, but this is no foe to fear now. Make your way through the scorching path ahead as fast as you can.
As if answering to your fighting spirit, strong warriors await ahead. Enveloped in wings of flames, these two swordsmen are swelling with energy.
A gigantic shadow blocks your path at the top of the mountain. It seems there is no way to pass through the volcano without a confrontation.
It looks like something's on Tilith's mind. If everyone said they trust her, then what could be wrong? It's a tad worrisome.
Surprised by the sounds of footsteps, they turn out to be only small crabs. Walking on the rocky area washed by the waves, you feel like you'll slip.
The sounds of waves mix with a voice in song. They sing the magical song of a water spirit. The enemy isn't strong, but don't let it slow you down.
You reach the sand after the rocky area. A hero with an ambition as great as the sea, and another with a will of ice, ambush you upon arrival.
The cliff in the distance you were headed towards begins to move. It was actually your enemy, and you have no choice but to defeat it to move forward.
What could be the truth Zurg keeps mentioning? Regardless of how reliable his testimony may be, it still gets the imagination going.
The forest capital of Vriksha. Seeing how much it truly differs from the Vriksha of yore, you can't help but wonder what happened to this country.
Strange, this is the same path you took before. It seems that the forest is enchanted. You must find the source of this spell and eliminate it.
Exiting to an open space lit by the sun, the birds shriek. A hero with a weapon from another world, and another with a magic lance, stand before you.
A mountain made of stone suddenly appears before you. Just when you thought it was in your way, it swings at you. It's a puppet controlled by magic!
Though Paris is hostile towards the Summoners' Hall, there's a particular antagonism in the air when she looks at Grahdens. It must mean something.
Water tainted red and a mysterious creature shining light by it. Out of all the places you've been to so far, this one feels the eeriest. Be careful.
A deafening voice combined with the flash of thunder. A bird soars the skies creating electric shocks as it revolves. But it's not just one bird...
As the thunder clouds roar in the sky, rain starts to fall. At the same time, two heroes appear and obstruct your path. You sense a fight is imminent.
The rain has ceased and light trickles through the clouds. As if on a staircase of light, an angel descends. Defeat her and proceed to the Sky Palace.
No matter how true Zurg's words may be, helping him to destroy humans is not an option. Of course, you wouldn't betray the Goddess anyway.
You can't believe that such a beautiful garden floats in midair just like that. What sort of magic could be at work here?
A fighting goddess forbids you from moving forward, as if she cannot forgive those who disturb her garden. However, there's no stopping now.
You reach the castle at the heart of the garden. When you set foot there, a hero wielding a holy blade and a knight with a great sword appear.
You can see the gate that marks the exit of the Sky Palace. However, in front of it stands a shiny and pale king of beasts. It's time for battle.
Tilith seems to be feeling better, which is a relief. No one else is hung up on Zurg's words either. With a unified front, head towards Adan's Tower.
This eerie place makes it feel like ghosts could appear at any moment. Proceed with caution. You're getting closer to enemy territory now.
A feeling of uneasiness lingers in the air, but you travel lightly on your feet. Knowing you must defeat the Fallen God, there's no time to waste.
The ill wills of revenge and madness prevent you from stepping any further. The hero waiting ahead looks powerful, so prepare yourself.
A young woman awaits outside the rear gate of the castle. It would seem she's holding a sword in her right hand, and concentrated magic on the other.
The surroundings are overflowing with the presence of the enemy. Head for the top while Karl serves as a distraction. The real battle draws near.
You cannot find the staircase that leads upstairs, so you take the only way available deep inside. The path seems slanted, slowly curving upwards.
The curved hallway spirals upwards and upwards. If you stumble when you lose in battle, you may end up tumbling all the way down...
You reach the top to find a large room. As if the same type of powerful enemy had been waiting for you all along, you're suddenly attacked.
You go upstairs, open the doors, and find another large room. After just one step, the doors close and a strong enemy is summoned. Just a bit more.
After a fierce battle, you climb your way up through some narrow stairs. On your way to the top an enemy shows itself, but there's no going back now!
Finally at the top, there's no doubt that Zurg is waiting. If you defeat the disciple of the last Fallen God, Afla Dilith will be the only enemy left!
You look far into the distance and notice the shadow of an eerie castle. They say that it is the last form Afla Dilith morphed into...
The footprints of Lugina and the others who had gone ahead have vanished. Strong gusts of wind hit the sand dunes, continuously changing their shape.
The blazing sun is wearing you down, dehydrating you. You've crossed many scorching territories so far, but somehow never seem to grow used to them.
As the sparkling sand reflects the sunlight, your feet grow hotter and hotter. At this rate they'll end up well-done while they roast...
Your thirst and the sun aren't your only enemies. Afla Dilith has dispatched assassins who are closing in on you. The end of the desert isn't far now.
Indeed there are other gods besides the Four Fallen that reject the existence of humans. However, let's focus on the task at hand for now.
The sun shines through an ice wall and though no light is lit within the temple, it's bright inside. The light suddenly refracts, creating a rainbow.
The solitude of the ice temple makes for a very relaxing atmosphere. However, with enemies incoming, you have no time to rest.
Could this temple also be the work of the gods? Or is it the masterpiece of a person with otherworldly powers? It piques your curiosity.
Everything is gradually turning brighter. The exit may be close, but things will probably not be as simple as you think.
An ancient forest that few have visited before. There seem to be no natural paths. You'll have to use your sense of direction to get out of this one.
A strange feeling overcomes you. You've sensed this atmosphere in many of the forests you have passed through so far. No doubt spirits are near.
Along with a shrilling cry, a flock of birds flies off frightened. A loud roar follows after. It's the sound of an otherworldly machine at work!
You get the feeling that something is inviting you deep into the sea of trees. You can't help thinking you're being led to a den full of enemies.
The space between the trees has widened. The end of the forest may be near. This can only mean that enemies more powerful than before await you.
The fate of the future... What Paris told you is starting to make sense. However, you must first focus on defeating the last Fallen God.
The large drops of rain won't stop, striking you as they fall. Your body gets colder, and as you sneeze, the sound of thunder resonates around you.
You can tell that in Aldahlia the buildings soaked in rainwater have been eroding away. You start to wonder how long this rain will keep falling.
A bright bolt of lightning tears the sky apart. After a second of waiting, a deafening sound hits your ears. Lighting struck dangerously close.
The continuous roaring of the thunder has made your ears feel funny. You wouldn't survive an ambush in this state, so you best be cautious.
It's still a long way to Afla Dilith, but everyone keeps talking about what will come after that. Let's not worry about those things for now.
The herd of Pegasus was just frightened, but something more alarming soars the skies. War goddesses spread their wings to prepare for battle.
This road offers a clear view of the surroundings, so there's no fear of an ambush. However, there's nothing you can use to deflect aerial attacks.
How long have you advanced? Now you can really see the castle Afla Dilith has assimilated with. Is that what you will face in the future?
A road for pilgrims. Long ago, pilgrims passed through here to pray to the gods. Ironically, you're taking this road in order to defeat a god.
The end of the road is near. A strong power can be felt coming from it. The enemy lurking there will most likely be your last obstacle here.
You are overwhelmed by the gigantic stature of the castle-like Afla Dilith. However, everyone is counting on you, so there's no time to waste.
There are still many enemies left on the way to the castle. Surely Karl and the others will have to face even more of them as you move on ahead.
The sound of your allies fighting behind you grows louder. Head towards the castle while everyone else draws the enemies' attention.
The enemies in your path continue getting stronger. It can only mean that your last target is drawing near. The castle's gates should be just ahead.
The castle is within a stone's throw, and the god's powerful presence grows stronger. However, it's no time to buckle under pressure. Step inside.
You can see the last hoard of enemies in front of the gate. If you can get past them, you will finally be inside Afla Dilith!
Tilith, Karl, everyone... You're worried about the friends you left behind fighting. However, there's no turning back now. You must press forward.
Looking inside the castle, nothing really seems out of place. Although without Tilith's protective barrier, you might have fallen prey to Afla Dilith.
You can hear Tilith fighting from the entrance. Inspired by her courage, your feet rush forward at full speed!
As you proceed further in, the sounds of battle coming from the entrance disappear. You can still feel Tilith's barrier protecting you, though.
You've made your way through a big portion of the fortress. Past this corridor lies its center. The real body of the Fallen God is probably there.
You exit into a room enveloped in tree roots. The next step should lead you to the heart of the castle, but a dark hero blocks your path.
The time for the real final fight with the last Fallen God, the Beast God Afla Dilith, has come... Defeat him and return to your friends!
After visiting the temple a second time, you think you hear the voice of a young girl singing. Her song made the rough waves vanish like the sea foam.
A hair raising howling can be heard. It looks like many monsters seem to inhabit this town, so there seems to be no easy escape from here.
A beautiful singing voice lingers in the air. Could this be the work of a demon as well? And why have so many monsters gathered in this ghost town?
How strange. No matter how much you advance, you keep finding yourself back where you started. It's like being in the fairies' grove all over again.
There are too many enemies. What could've led them here? As you think that to yourself, a piercing and thunderous sound resonates around you.
The neigh of a Pegasus reaches your ears, a pure sound ill-fitted for this ghost town. A battle with the maidens awaits ahead.
You can feel many more enemies obstructing your way now. If you're lucky enough, defeating the last hoard of them might be your ticket out of here.
You can see a vast desert in front of you. There seems to be no end to it, but you must take this cruel path in order to move forward.
You confirm the sun's location to avoid losing your way. Short on patience and with your body almost boiling, beads of sweat fall from your forehead.
A cloud of sand starts covering your clothes. You swallow the fine pieces of sand the wind picks up as you breathe. Deserts are still not your forte.
As the sunshine gets hotter, heat haze begins to rise from beneath. Beyond the shaky mirage in front of you, you spy the creeping shadow of the enemy.
A cloudless, blue firmament above, and scorching, yellow sand beneath. As you look behind you, everything grows darker. A sandstorm is on its way.
After leaving the great the desert behind, you come across a river so big that the shore seems invisible. It will take a lot of effort to cross it.
At times, the river fish jump high up. Surprised by the sound, you finally see the enemy closing in. You realize now the fish were trying to warn you.
Halfway up the river you hear a creaking noise and see that the surface of the river has begun to freeze. It seems the enemy is here.
As you admire the grandeur of this river, you reminisce of battle. Even though you have defeated the Four Fallen Gods, other battles still lie ahead.
A strong wind blows. The water's surface ripples, and then crashes in a big splash. It may be a sign of the road up ahead, which makes you nervous.
As you walk through the thick forest, you get lost. The path to a free future... You'll have to make your own way to get there.
You arrive at a place in the forest where a small spring bubbles. You consider taking a rest, but enemies start appearing one by one. Break's over.
A strong wind blows in the forest. As the leaves brush upon each other they sound like the waves of the ocean. It's a sea of trees indeed.
Breeze blows strongly through the trees, picking up old leaves, and fluttering new ones. This is the force that transforms the forest anew.
The sea of trees sways as the wind hits it. One could say that even these living beings feel anxious about the future fate of the world.
The rough, shiny rock around shows traces of lightning. It seems it has been absorbing it during the endless storms. Pressing forward won't be easy.
As you climb an electrified cliff, you pass peaks as sharp as needles. You can't help but feel like this road is a premonition of the future to come.
The thunder and lightning that falls here is absorbed by the mountain. It has accumulated so much after the years that it might burst any minute now.
You've reached the Mt. Granakia's highest peak, where you can see the whole of Atharva. You see a giant castle in the distance. Is that Eriole's base?
You can see Paris at the bottom of the cliff. It seems she followed you here. You were told to talk to her, but what exactly do you have in mind?
After climbing over the mountain, you reach a beautiful garden. However, no people seem to come here, so how has it been kept so well maintained?
Beautiful flower beds are arranged next to each other in the garden. These amazing flowers couldn't have bloomed without lots of care, and yet...
You can see a fountain amidst the flower beds. The water sparkles as it flows from a beautifully carved pedestal. What a great spectacle to behold.
Small birds flutter about, chirping a song. One flees suddenly, and when you follow it with your eyes, you see a great shadow dropping from the sky...
The floral aroma, the chirping of the birds, and the beauty of the trimmed hedges... Looking at it now, this is a beautiful, if not perfect, garden.
Could this garden have been made by human hands? How could it have remained so beautiful without any people left to care for it?
Small flowers sway in the wind, butterflies flutter about, and the birds fly high in the sky. A wind of new beginnings is leaving the old age behind.
Having passed the gorgeous garden, you reach a gloomy cemetery. Among the expressionless tombstones standing, a voice calls from within the silence.
Tesla said Paris was useless to them now. If Eriole truly feels that way, then just what could he be after...?
This part of the cemetery seems to be dedicated to soldiers fallen in battle. You can see that their tombstones have a sword symbol carved onto them.
If a civil war breaks in Elgaia, many lives will be lost. This must be prevented at all costs.
Reading the few words you can make out from the headstones, you gather that this was once one of the most important places in Atharva.
You feel something cold run down your spine. Feeling an evil presence, you look around you. Darkness is closing in, the enemy's coming!
Not even the wind seems to reach this place, and your movements start to feel sluggish. The smell of moss and mold lingers in the air.
The spark of battle has been ignited. Defeat the enemies standing in your way, and head towards the depths of Eriole's castle!
A cold steel blade strikes at you, and fiery claws rush towards you. No matter who the enemy may be, you must not falter!
A fist cracks the floor open, and a lance tries to pierce you as you counterattack. Strong enemies have gathered here, but you must press on!
Lightning flashes in the hall, and a sword that seems to block darkness shimmers brightly. If you want to stop the revolution, focus on the enemy now!
Light pierces the walls, and countless arrows begin to rain down. The enemy is strong, but you still have morale. Hurry and make your way through!
Dual blades dance in the air, and one strike from a hefty lance breaks the floor open. Just a bit more till you face Eriole deep in the castle.
The shadow overhead is just as strong as the light. The world is being distorted, probably tearing at the seams. You're just steps away from Eriole!
Eriole's ideas are warped. The idea that a bloody revolution can bring about a peaceful future cannot possibly be true. He must be stopped.
You discover a cave dispersing an ominous miasma. There are traces of a strong seal at the entrance, but you seem to be able to come and go freely.
As you approach the heart of the gloomy forest, you think you hear the cry of the ancient dragon rumored to be sealed within it.
After fighting away the dragons, you hear the voices of the deceased singing around you. It looks like the creatures of this forest mean to stop you.
You get the eerie feeling that someone's watching you. Could it be Ark? No, this stare is from the beings dwelling in the forest.
The dim forest is full of silence. The moment you think your ears have grown accustomed to it, a flock of birds suddenly lets out a shrilling cry.
After the flock of birds has gone, you encounter a group of fighting goddesses. They study you as if trying to gauge your power.
You're almost out of the forest. You want to meet Tilith as soon as possible to talk to her, but the demonic miasma around you refuses to allow it.
The combination of Seria's excessively threatening attitude and all your memories of Tilith leave you in silence. You best follow the Goddess anyway.
The heat haze rising from the sand is as hot as fire itself. It even makes you wonder whether it is actually aflame.
It is only normal to feel hot in a desert, but you've never felt this degree of heat before. It's a premonition of the enemies who want to stop you.
The scorching desert is draining your energy. It doesn't seem like Tilith will appear here, but if you meet her again, you should try talking to her.
You feel a presence. There's no doubt that Tilith is near. You want to avoid a fight with her, but how will it all turn out...?
A red river flows ahead. It reminds you of a red forest from your previous exploits. Just like during those hard times, Tilith is still by your side.
What could be awaiting you? You are not completely sure, but watching the crimson waves makes you all the more uneasy.
The red splash is freezing. You have now seen this omen of the strong opponents ahead a number of times. Beware of your surroundings and get ready.
The red current looks just like blood. If humans were to be destroyed once again, the landscape would probably resemble an image like this one.
The reflection of the light on the water makes the river sparkle. Its color made you uncomfortable before, but it may make for a beautiful view now.
You have arrived at a ghost town. It was probably a normal village before it was destroyed. Thick grass grows along the remnants of the streets.
You were only worried about were stepped, but now you've noticed a gigantic tower in the distance. It must be the so-called Tower of the Oracle.
The greenery around you has grown louder. It could all be in your head, but is it possible that the insects are trying to warn you? The enemy's here!
Humans don't fully understand the concept of a god yet. However, looking at Tilith you can't help but to feel there's not much of a difference.
In the outskirts of the village lies a small shrine. As you go past it, you lay your eyes upon the tower standing ahead. Ark awaits you.
What could Ark's real motives be? Why is he attempting to test the Summoners' power? Or could he be trying to end it all here?
The enemy is strong. However, you won't just stop fighting. Your ability to stop the Four Fallen Gods was no hoax, but Ark is well aware of that.
Thunder clouds roar within the walls of the tower. Did you set off a trap, or could this be the enemy's power? Either way, you must push through.
You're close to the top of the tower. As you continue forth, you feel a strong presence. Could the beings Ark mentioned be waiting ahead?
What could have those enemies been? Many seemed to have been related to Ark somehow. That must mean that the next enemy is...
Ark's words had a strong impact. What does Lucius plan to do with humanity now? There's no choice but to seek him and ask him directly.
When Ark removed his mask, his determination was written all over his face. Will you be able to hear any more important information from him again?
Tilith seems completely at a loss about what Ark said regarding Lucius. It seems even she doesn't know everything about her master.
A tension in the air is putting everything on edge. Is this the wrath of the heroes? Ark's figure is slowly becoming visible.
The curse of Karna Masta... Summoning was believed to be a power granted by Lucius, but things seem more complicated than that.
The history left behind is only a small portion of the history that has actually taken place. What new knowledge could be awaiting in the future?
Tilith said she became Lucius's disciple after the great war with the gods. There may be even more things Tilith doesn't know than initially thought.
It seems a fight against Lucius is imminent now. If only you could convince Tilith otherwise...
This place is said to have been where people received divine commands from the gods. It must be a special place for the Oracle Knight Ark.
The rocks' tough exterior seems to want to keep people away, but it may be testing if you have enough strength to finish the dreaded climb.
How many moons have passed since this mountain lost its original purpose? The darkness that lingers in these mountain paths is quite dense.
A shadow lurks in the ridge below. This figure clad in jet black armor is perhaps the lone knight the Six Heroes mentioned. It's time for battle.
As you make your climb down the steep cliff, demons come after you. Only a little bit more until you reach the Grand Gaia Crater where Lucius awaits.
If only Lucius would reconsider his decision of destroying humanity, a battle could be avoided... Is this mentality perhaps too idealistic?
The battle has finally begun. Lucius seems to have no intentions of listening to humans. Tilith's words are also cause for concern...
If Lucius is defeated, only Tilith will be able to control the gate. You must think of a countermeasure to deal with the sealed calamities within.
You were victorious against all Four Fallen Gods. However, now you fully understand that Lucius's power surpasses that of any previously defeated god.
Gods and humans seem to be looking at things quite differently. However, if they mean to destroy humanity, you've no choice but to stop them.
Lucius doesn't speak much. Did he fool everyone? Or did humans selfishly come up with their own expectations of him?
You wonder if Karl and the others are unharmed. They must have crossed many a powerful enemy on the way here. Quickly, you must reach Lucius!
Grand Gaia's Crater... Is this the place where countless calamities lie sealed within? No, now is not the time for distractions.
