Tilith has led you all the way here. That was Lucius's will. However, now you must fight with your own will in mind!
You have reached the depths of this territory sealed by the gods. Within it lies the results of an experiment that offends their divinity...
The land of the sealed demons, Ishgria. Many different creatures from those in Elgaia can be found here.
A large and strangely designed stone structure stands before you. Obviously from a different culture, it draws both curiosity and fear.
In the center of the ruins is a large circular plaza. Though the buildings are abandoned now, this seems to have been a prestigious place.
You still feel no presence of menacing demons around you. It was wrong to think that they would be running rampant here, but don't get careless.
From the top of the ruins you see a fantastic view of the land. However, when you remember you have to travel it on foot, your motivation fades.
You've felt no demonic presences until now. It looks like finding the demons in charge of this land will prove harder than you initially thought.
A demon appears before you and suddenly attacks. There is no escape. Especially now that you'll serve as a sacrifice for the goddess!
You never thought that the demon who controls this land would show itself so quickly. Keep your eyes peeled for traps ahead.
Bridges have been built over the hot vapors that rise from below. One wrong step, and it's all over. You will need a lot of courage to pass through.
Thanks to the rising hot vapors your throat has dried up, and your head feels like it's boiling. Even Paris can't hide the fact that she's struggling.
You can finally see the exit, but an incredibly hot wind blows from its direction. Apparently its heat source differs from that of the lava below.
You come across some beautiful ponds and cascades which resemble sets of stairs. According to Paris, this water is like acid. Don't go for a dip.
This place full of so much dangerous acid makes you wonder if a lot of Ishgria's terrain is similar to this one. It's a bit disconcerting.
To your surprise you find creatures resembling fish and small shrimp swimming in the acid. This place is definitely different from Elgaia.
When you feel something strange on your shoe, you look down to find it has begun to disintegrate. You should watch your step here.
You have finally reached the end of the cascades to find yourself in a dark valley of sorts. However, you must defeat a strong enemy to move forward.
You step foot into the thick forest in the valley. However, what surrounds you are giant mushrooms, not trees. You feel like a sort of dwarf...
The light cannot reach the depths of this dark forest. Instead, you let yourself be guided through these soft lands by luminous mushrooms.
You run into something hard while walking. Surprisingly it seems to be the root of a great tree, but you don't remember seeing any trees around...
The aroma of many types of mushrooms mixes in the air. So do their spores. You hope these spores aren't bad for your body, but Paris knows better.
It is so quiet that you think you can hear the sound of the spores floating around you. Suddenly though, a ferocious roar breaks the silence.
Your eyes had just gotten used to the darkness, when a flash of lightning blinds you. The view you see before you includes giant floating crystals.
An ominous red light emanates from the chained giant crystals that float midair. To think that you have to walk through such a place...
Storms of lightning rage above you, hitting the crystals from time to time. The electricity helps carve stairs and roads on the crystals' surface.
You find many rooms within the crystal structures. Do demons live here? Humans wouldn't be able to survive in such a place...
You managed to make it through this strange place and resurface to land. However, an opponent seems to be preparing to fight you.
Lots of preparations are probably being made back home in Elgaia. If possible you want to rescue Tilith before war breaks out, but...
You fight your enemies while a pillar shaped light gleams before you. How does this structure work? A terrible demonic aura surrounds this place.
As you contemplate the Light Tower you begin to wonder about the demon civilization. Do they all have different roles to play as humans do?
A demon named Shusui is said to rule these lands. Is it due to his orders that other demons refuse to show themselves?
You're making your way down the tower and will be outside soon. However, the enemies seem to be getting stronger now. Proceed with caution.
After exiting the Light Tower, you come across some sparkling trees. Unlike the mushroom forest, these look like real trees, only made of stone.
Though you've encountered various creatures in the previous terrains, this one is awfully quiet. Is as if all life here has died out.
A building in ruins sleeps within the forest. Completely broken down and in shambles, it resembles the bones of a dead gigantic creature.
If you look closely, you can see signs of ancient battles having taken place here. You start to wonder what the exiled disciples' battles were like.
From an opening in the trees you can see an enormous building in the distance. Is this the Soaring Tree Tower Shusui spoke of? You're almost there.
The gigantic tower might as well be a skyscraper piercing the sea of clouds. Could its candle-like branches be the stronghold of a demon?
As thunder rumbles behind you, you enter the mysterious tower. Before you stands a tough enemy whose plans remain unclear. No choice but to continue.
Every enemy awaiting you only seems to get stronger by the minute. You're only halfway through the tower, so there's no time to rest yet.
No matter how you think of it, what Shusui says makes little sense. Why is he testing you? You can't read the demon's mind at all.
You can feel a great power ahead, but it doesn't belong to a demon. Could it be Shusui's last trial? Better prepare yourself before proceeding.
An entirely different enemy than any of the ones the fallen heroes before you ever faced is expecting you at the top of the tower. Shusui awaits.
Shusui suddenly shows himself before you once again. Why is he after you now? Does it have to do with something from this land?
The burning light of the lava inside the caverns tans your skin. The overwhelming black and red colors blind your vision. Don't let your guard down.
If you don't watch your step, you may end up stepping in the hot lava. Sticking your foot in there does not look like a good idea.
You get an uneasy, yet familiar feeling, and remember the fear of facing a disciple. There's no doubt that a strong enemy awaits ahead.
You follow a hot trail. The ground, walls, and even the ceiling is scorching hot. Your feet feel like they're burning through the soles of your shoes.
A ferocious roar echoes through the cavern. At the same time, you feel a cool breeze waft in. It looks like the exit is near.
The goddess Mora suddenly appears before you. When she mentions she once served Lord Lucius, you can't help but to remember Tilith.
You've seen many a spectacular scenery in Ishgria, so now that you're at the Wetlands, you can truly appreciate their bizarre beauty.
You feel anxious knowing a presence near you holds terrible power. The humidity of the wetlands clings to your skin, making you really uncomfortable.
Mora guides you through the Wetlands. Since it's Seria and Lugina, you know they are safe, but you can't help to worry a little.
There's a faint aroma of sea breeze in the moist air.  This change can only mean that the end of the Wetlands is near.
The power of a person similar to Karl has been awakened? What could it mean? You hope Karl is safe as you wonder what this is all about.
Paris warns that the thick and overgrown plants here are different from the ones in Grand Gaia. Some of them may be poisonous, so be careful.
Another bad feeling. That's the third time since you arrived to Lem. Without a doubt, an enemy with great power approaches. Brace yourself.
Pushing your way through an animal trail, you reach a small thicket. Hearing a rustle coming from the bushes, you ready yourself. It was an animal.
The giant trees have cleared out. Now you can probably make it out of the forest quicker. The possibilities of encountering enemies are high though.
Paris can't seem to hide her fascination for the ancient dragon. However, you should hurry forward if you want to make sure everyone's okay.
Your body goes slightly numb after approaching an electrified crystal. Best be careful of your surroundings and keep some distance from the crystals.
You feel something ominous. A frightfully strong enemy is bound to show itself at any minute, but there seems to be no way to escape.
You climb over the great ancient dragon's claws. You don't want to fight an opponent this gigantic, but you may have to in the future...
The small electrified crystals have gotten much bigger, and the dragon's bones are almost invisible now. The Ruins can't be far from here.
You're surprised by Paris's course of action. You had vaguely noticed a change, but now it's clear that this Paris is more free spirited than before.
You head towards the Ruins in search of Seria and Lugina. Now that Paris is not around, walking behind the silent Mora doesn't feel right.
A bad feeling overcomes you. A sharp, blood thirsty will made of pure evil draws near. There's nowhere to run, so prepare a good counterattack.
Just how far did Paris go? You can't pick up any presences around you, but whatever you encounter will not be weak. It would be good to regroup.
Things are happening so suddenly, there is no time to react. What could Mora be thinking? There's no time to ponder about that either.
After being apart for such a long time, you reunite with Seria and Lugina. Now you must begin all preparations necessary to face Mora once again.
The black rocks and red lava remind you of the first caverns you passed through. It's not that hot here, but you're thrown off by the ominous miasma.
A bad feeling once again. You've felt this countless times by now, this evil intent to kill. And combined with the miasma, chills run down your spine.
When you look behind you, it seems as if all the land were illuminated by lightning. Perhaps it's the dragon's suffering. A long bridge stands ahead.
After climbing down a steep hill, you grow closer to the great bridge. The miasma around you makes everything creepier as it points towards the enemy.
The demon Mora finally reveals her true identity. She says that if you wish to know Karl's whereabouts, you must defeat her first. Can you trust her?
Crossing the great bridge with Lugina reminds you of your time in Lizeria. With that in mind you wonder how your relationship has made it this far.
Thanks to Paris and Lugina's help, you won't face many traps along the way. But the demons Mora has sent come at you one after another.
You may have beaten a disciple, but its presence is not completely gone. Countless disciple-like demons come after you, but you're only halfway there.
It's battle after battle, but while caught up in them you feel a new,  yet strange power approaching. It feels familiar somehow though...
After defeating Shusui anew, you head towards the end of the bridge. However, you feel that demonic presence again. You know which demon awaits now.
The demon Mora suddenly appears before you again. What is a demon's shadow? And just what could be going on in Ishgria?
The lava before you makes you falter a little. No matter how many trying places you've visited, you'll need resolve to get out of this one.
The air carries the fiery breath of a dragon. There's no doubt that a group of them is nearby. Best move quietly to avoid any confrontations.
It's so hot you want to resort to Lugina's rude vocabulary to describe the temperature. Your skin stings too, perhaps because you're a bit burnt?
The sound of the lava flow is unexpectedly pleasant, until you suddenly hear a deafening roar. It might be smart to prepare for battle.
This hell-like lava path seems to be almost over. However, menacing presences still lurk about. Could this be the demon's assassins?
Very impactful scenery suddenly comes into view. A deep red sea spreads before your eyes. Its hue makes you realize anew you're in another world.
Though the sea has a red tint to it, its smell is not strange at all. This disparity makes you uncomfortable and highly confuses you.
You've seen the sea dyed by the colors of the sunset before, but you're sure this water's hue is something entirely different. You start feeling sick.
The "Six Armors" that Mora mentioned, which rival demonic powers, start to bug you. You may have to fight them in the future.
Are all of Ishgria's oceans red? While thinking that to yourself, a horde of enemies shows up. This is no time to take it easy.
Seria was right. This place really doesn't resemble a laboratory. However, if you look closely you'll see a lot of strange equipment.
The ruins turned laboratory are being swallowed by the forest. You can feel great vitality coming from the plants growing along the walls.
Even though the facility has been eroded by the forest, a part of it still seems to be alive. The science behind it was indeed efficient.
A very misplaced and dense floral aroma drifts in the air. You still don't know much about Ishgria's nature, so you would do well to be cautious.
You're almost out of the laboratory, but Lugina and Paris are still nowhere to be seen. Seria's also taken her own path, so just keep moving forward.
As something fearsome drops from the heavens and comes after you, you realize there is no room to talk. The battle has already started.
The strong wind doesn't cease blowing. The wood of the gigantic and heavy windmill towering over you makes a loud creaking noise as it turns.
The strong wind may be somewhat depressing, but at least it's neither too hot nor too cold. There's no apparent danger in sight either.
A violent squall almost sent you flying. Looks like this is yet another place where you can't let your guard down. Be careful.
Though the windmill seems pretty old, it is still in very good condition, and even mobile. Could this have been the energy source for the lab?
Beiorg shows himself before you again. Would it be wise to fight this enemy with a function that makes him stronger after every defeat?
While looking at the landscape you realize that both demons and humans must have lived here long ago. Could humans really have inhabited Ishgria?
After passing numerous alleys on a hill, you finally find the main road. However, where could the inhabitants of such a great city have gone?
When you turn on a corner of the main road, you see that a group of enemies has been waiting for you. Could these be the protectors of this old city?
You have reached the outer wall of the old city. It may be due to the materials it's made of, but it's still somehow untarnished and pearly white.
If you climb this set of strange-looking stairs, you will reach the old castle. However, climbing all these stairs is slightly depressing.
The stairs keep going up, and up. You start to worry about Owen, but according to what Seria and Lugina said, you just have to trust he's fine.
Even though there seems to be no end to this staircase, the enemies don't find it a problem to attack you. Be careful not to miss your step and fall.
Due to the nature of this place, you can't avoid any fights. On top of that, enemies keep attacking you from high places, so you're in a tough spot.
You can see the entrance to the castle. Once you clear the next wave of enemies, you should be able to go inside. That's where the real battle awaits.
You destroy all the mechanisms you see before you as you move forth. It's possible that Karl is here, but what would he be doing in this place?
As you look at the lights that flash on the floors and walls, you feel as if you had been swallowed by a giant machine. Perhaps that's what happened?
You keep destroying all the equipment you lay your eyes upon, but nothing seems to happen. What is the purpose of all these gadgets anyway?
Beiorg seems to be able to alter his stature and size, but there's no way he'd make the castle a part of his body...is there?
By the way, where did Beiorg run off to? If this place is as important as Mora claims, then he should be here to protect it, and yet...
As you wander around the silent castle, you hear a strange sound echo through its halls. It seems like Beiorg is on his way to you after all!
Behind the castle and down the cliff lies a forest of dry trees. Will another demonic shadow show itself here? No more demons should be around, but...
Owen says one shouldn't have overly positive expectations. Let your guard down for a second, and you will be defeated. Better prepare yourself well.
The city is burning. What could be the fuel of these flames, and when will they stop burning? Ishgria is truly a strange place.
Speckles of fire keep falling like rain. What could have happened to this place that is now burning? The mystery only deepens.
The inside of the structure is as hot as a furnace. A minute longer inside, and you'll be cooked alive. Hurry towards the giant flowers.
As you pass the city, the fire is not as intense, but the amount of smoke is overwhelming. Breathing it in could be dangerous, so hurry along.
You reach a lifeless lake housing water that is clearly not meant for drinking. The miasma that has settled in the place makes your stay unbearable.
The stench makes you frown as you stumble about. If you spend too long here, your insides may just get poisoned.
The atmosphere is terrible. It must be hard for the demons to live here, but impossible for humans to do the same. It weakens the spirit.
A section of the lake seems to be boiling. However, it's not water springing forth, nor is the water really boiling. It's the effect of pollution.
Could this lake and the burning city have been in their current state since the beginning? Or is there a reason behind their extreme conditions?
The giant flowers which gave this region its name finally come into sight. The miasma they release is so strong, it can be seen with the naked eye...
Could the flowers' miasma be pollen? The miasma that fills the air is even more hazardous to one's health than the lake's pollution.
You begin to feel dizzy. The miasma is starting to take its toll. Cover your mouth with some cloth, and try not to breathe it all in.
Why would these dangerous plants settle in the city ruins? Do they not affect the demons as well? That seems improbable somehow...
You encounter a revolting creature. If you don't get out of here now, your body will suffer irreparable damage.
Who could that creepy man have been? He looked human enough, but...does he live in Ishgria? He can't be trusted.
Could crossing this long bridge made entirely of metal be really safe? Lightning won't stop flashing, so you can't seem to calm down...
The bridge is very high up, and falling would send you head-first into the red water below. Your chances of surviving such a fall are slim though...
Treading carefully, you cross the bridge with extreme caution. Touching it could lead to an electric shock, so you don't want to fight here, but...
You had no idea of what to do when Shusui attacked you on such a narrow bridge, but you somehow survived the encounter. Just a little further now.
Karl said he still has his doubts, and those words echo in your head. However, the enemy could care less and attacks you.
The fluids of demons lie scattered around everywhere, making you feel sick. Mora claimed it was because of the flowers' miasma, but...
That demon seems to have been Lucius's old disciple, but you've heard nothing of the sort before. Would Ark know about him?
What could have happened to Owen and that man? Owen would never fall for the traps lying around these parts, but...
As you go deeper within the lair, you feel a cold chill about you. Could there be something at the bottom? You should go take a look.
What could have that man meant to say? He said he resents the Summoners of Old...so could he be a Summoner himself?
Crystals that sparkle amidst the darkness are beautiful. They are lovely to look at, but could they really be as dangerous as that man claims?
You've heard many legends that tell of beautiful crystals which can grant demonic powers. Could these be the same crystals of lore?
The enemies here are stronger than those outside. Could it be the work of the crystals? Be careful not to get possessed by them.
You know you're almost out of the cave when you feel a draft. The old castle where the demon Melord awaits shouldn't be too far now.
You don't mind being entrusted with Karl, but you want to discuss what's going on with him. Look for Karl as soon as you finish that demon.
The castle is in shambles. The passage of time, the influence of that rotting demon, and Owen's rage must have destroyed it. Time to find that demon.
Grahdens mentioned that someone in Ishgria resents the Summoners of Old. However, the existence of such a creature is surprising in itself.
As you go deeper into the castle, a familiar stench hits your nostrils. Melord seems to be near, so hurry towards him.
The slime on the walls is still fresh. You hear something that sounds like Owen on a rampage. You have to keep moving forward.
Melord, Lucius's former disciple, now lives as a demon corrupted by the miasma and demon crystals. Make sure you're in top shape for this fight.
You find Melord in a graveyard of rotting ships. Now the disciple of the Sealed God comes after you to do the bidding of his master!
Lava flows systematically around this place, creating black smoke. According to Mora, this place is based on a factory from another world.
Owen advances even farther. The cowardly enemies that have avoided his path now come after you in return.
The heat of the lava intensifies the atmosphere around you. Fighting under these conditions makes it hard to breathe. Careful not to break something.
Apparently, what's flowing around is not lava, but molten metal. Is someone trying to build something with all this material?
A wind that could burn your skin comes blasting in. This doesn't seem to be a part of the factory, but of a strong enemy waiting ahead.
Paris was concerned about the large number of liquid-type monsters, but it seems those creatures can adapt to the habitat of any world.
Luminous water flows freely around you. Could the speckles of light in it be bugs? Even the flowers growing around the basin seem to glow.
Is this glowing water safe to drink? You spot a Squirty playing in it and can't help but wonder if this is the source of its larger evolutions.
Though this shiny water is strange, it is beautiful in its own way. If there were no danger lurking about, it would be the perfect place for a stroll.
The smell of the coast wafts in, though there is no ocean in sight. It's safer to assume that a powerful enemy is behind it instead.
Karl's secrecy has you very upset. But it doesn't seem like he has changed at the core, so that relieves you somewhat.
Seemingly a clump of plants from afar, from up close one can see that a lot of care was put into planting these trees. This garden was man-made.
The glass ceiling lets a strange light shine in. This light and the temperature are both regulated, making the perfect environment for these plants.
Taking a closer look, you notice there are also plants from Elgaia in this garden. Scientists could potentially make great discoveries in this place.
You're taken aback by the great tree in the middle of the garden. Could it be the great and otherworldly Alpha Tree?
Mirfah challenges you to a duel to learn your true intentions. You cannot just ignore him, so prepare yourself and do the best you can.
Independence from the gods. This is a story you have heard a few times before. However, you must press forward for Tilith's sake.
There are pieces of machinery scattered all over the place. They are piled up so high that you fear they make come crashing down.
Could these metal scraps have been part of a failed experiment to revive otherworldly techniques? In that case, this place could be a treasure trove.
A thunderous roar makes the metal scraps come crashing down. This beast's underground cry resonates in the air. A powerful enemy must await ahead.
A bright light shines over the great metropolis. Its size and structure rival those of Randall. However, oddly enough, no one seems to live here.
Could developed metropolises such as this one exist in other worlds? Perhaps Randall will come to resemble it someday .
Could the demon ruling this land be an entirely different being? So far it doesn't seem interested in a fight.
Though you're wondering why the demon of this land has not sought you out, don't forget that a certain persistent demon may come seeking a fight.
There is a great disc shining from above. It looks like it's at the top of a tower. However, there's something odd about it...
You descend into a gloomy underground road completely different from the world above. The walls and floor are dirty, and even the air feels polluted.
The world above was magnificent, but the world below leaves much to be desired. Why would demons come all the way down here looking for shelter?
You can't help but wonder how people would be able to live underground in this place if it were truly a possibility.
Underneath the city of light there is a place the light cannot touch. Even if technology fixed this in the future, society wouldn't probably allow it.
There seems to be an even deeper darkness lurking ahead. Walking this underground city makes you feel like you've fallen into the underworld.
It turns out Mordlim was just like the demons before it--an enemy of humanity. What Mora said still has you worried, but you must defeat this demon.
Not only can this device control the weather, but it can also cause disasters automatically. Such dangerous technology must be used with caution.
Perhaps if Elgaia had the power this tower possesses, there wouldn't be a need for humanity to fight the demons.
The more you think about it, the more Mordlim's plans sound terrifying. How would've things played out if you hadn't done anything about it?
You can feel that the demon has a powerful foes awaiting you. A great foe climbs its way to the top, while another descends from above. This is it.
Unbeknownst to anyone, Mordlim had continued with her sinister plans. If you don't stop her now, the future of humankind could be lost forever!
There is a secret sky garden behind the botanical garden. You're pretty sure you will encounter the demon Mordlim there, though she's been defeated.
Having passed through lava belts all across the land, you should be used to places like this. Avoid taking risks, and watch your step.
It seems the demon that rules this land has hair a color unlike any you have seen thus far. You could say it's very demonic, or not demonic at all.
The air here pulses with the heat. It is so intense that your sweat evaporates in an instant. Stay hydrated, and always be prepared for combat.
The enemies you face at every turn here are quite strong. However, you have built up ample power to defeat them. Move ahead boldly!
An incandescent wind blows by. The lava road seems to have an exit ahead, where the heat is most intense. A formidable foe most likely awaits you.
Mora continues to use you. It might be time to start thinking about what she aims to achieve with all her plotting.
A metallic scent unlike the rusted iron smell of the red sea tickles your nose. It seems that Elgaian common sense doesn't apply to Ishgria.
Mora said that it was impossible to comprehend Amu Yunos's thinking, but you have a feeling that the same is true of her and Shusui.
Suddenly, you can smell the salty breeze from a familiar sea. You should assume that this kind of change indicates a strong enemy is on its way.
You can see a dense forest ahead of you. It seems you will need to pass through it to reach the tower. Proceed down this beach just a little further.
It's good you were able to ask Karl's opinion. Even if your objectives are different, Karl wants to help Tilith just as much as you do.
As you head to the ruins that the forest has enveloped, you catch unsettling glimpses of what seems to be a giant through the trees.
The ancient cobblestones are so overgrown with moss that they are hardly recognizable. This seems like a nice place for a walk, a rarity in Ishgria.
The trees around you began to rustle. A wind is blowing past, deeper into the forest. It seems someone is inviting you in. Be prepared for battle.
When you think about it, you haven't seen Shusui for a while. Could he have given up? If so, you shouldn't need to worry about him, but...
The sky is filled with black clouds that flash with never-ending lightning. All there is to see around you is an expanse of barren earth.
Since you have a good view and allies with you, you can focus on enemies approaching from ahead. But watch your back just in case.
Lightning flashes, illuminating the sky. You hear an earsplitting roar and a suspicious shadow passes high above. It seems you have airborne enemies.
You heard a cliff collapsing over the thunder. Something large is approaching, shaking the earth as it does. You won't get away without fighting.
You made your way close to the castle. Now you need to climb a trail up the cliffs, but you'll have to fight difficult foes here as well.
You have learned what the Akras Summoners' Hall was truly after. And you think it might tie into saving Tilith. There's no room for hesitation now.
This castle seems to be quite old, but it doesn't look weathered at all. Actually, it seems in excellent condition. Is someone maintaining it?
Despite its formidable exterior, inside the castle is refined and sophisticated. It's said that Amu Yunos has always ruled this land, but...
From this high up in the castle, you are able to see the giant's face directly. Once again, you are amazed at its unimaginable size.
It seems there's a passage that extends from the castle to the neighboring mountains, offering an exit. But it also appears to lead toward the giant.
You sensed something from Mora that wasn't there before; something like confusion. You feel like you understand Seria's concern a little better.
You sense an almost-familiar presence. It could be that Shusui has caught up with you. Time to hurry.
The great giant's remains seem to be holding their form without decaying or breaking down. Is this the power of Amu Yunos at work?
Even while untouched by decay, the giant's corpse somehow makes you starkly aware of death. Are you over-thinking things?
You have reached the giant's feet. You should be able to walk to Amu Yunos's tower from here. You must be prepared for anything.
You never dreamed that a demon would call you chaotic. Maybe you should be more aware of the things you've done so far.
You defeated the Four Fallen Gods and Lucius, and now demons fall before you wherever you go. Will you also take out Karna Masta in the future?
Mora said that eight of them sealed Karna Masta, which means there are two other demons besides Amu Yunos.
You need to defeat the demons to save Tilith. But if you do that, the seal on Karna Masta will break...
Before you knew it, the top floor was but a few steps away. It's dangerous to fight while distracted. Make sure to keep yourself together.
Amu Yunos is a demon you must face to save Tilith. That's all the reason you need to fight. Prepare for battle.
For some reason, you have to face Owen now. If you refuse, Owen will probably flatten you anyway. So your only choice is to take him head on!
When you step into the glistening crystal cave, it seems there is a demon deep within. Amu Yunos's Shadow likely awaits you.
You sense serenity in Mirfah's expression, unlike before. Sometimes, fighting just to see who's strongest feels good.
An individual with the head of a dragon suddenly attacks. He identifies himself as a follower of the land's demon ruler, and you must fight back.
Disciple Liomerg addressed Karl respectfully. It seems that the demon in Karl's bloodline is the ruler of this land.
The flames form first a firestorm, then spin into towering fire whirls. Who knows what happens if you get close to them. Be careful as you advance!
It might be your imagination, but it seems like the enemies here are much more self-aware than any before, and that their attacks are more strategic.
You're almost clear of the land of burning winds. Your clothes smell a bit charred. You've got to hurry ahead before they catch fire.
Karl seems dead set on fighting no matter what. You're not done trying to talk him down yet, but you may need to face him in combat.
You feel you need to defeat Karna Masta. If you don't, humanity will forever live in fear of the god's resurrection.
You really want to believe in Karl. Despite this, you don't think the demon menace will go away even if Ishgria is unified.
Even if Karna Masta weren't a threat, you would need to eliminate the demon threat in order to free Tilith.
Regardless of whatever the demon Barion thought, you can't be sure without actually meeting it. Time to get moving.
A beautiful view of the continent extends before you. Compared to some other places, it's actually quite scenic.
Circle around a cliff, climb a slope, look for a path, and climb back down, again and again. But you caught sight of something like a waterfall ahead.
On cresting a particularly high hill, you realized that the waterfall was actually a structure damming the river. You will need to get through it.
Suddenly, you remember Mora's words. You can't imagine her becoming an ally, but if possible, you'd rather not have her as an enemy.
You can faintly hear what seems to be rushing water. That dam-like structure must be close. The enemies are fighting harder, as well.
There's nothing you can say to Paris in her distress. You just have to believe she'll find an answer for herself.
Apparently, this massive dam also functions as a fortress. The interior is maze-like, and it won't be easy to get through.
Formidable foes lie in wait at key points. As you fight an unpleasant thought crosses your mind, and you wonder if Karl sent them there.
You have gotten lost in the fortress. You need to focus on moving ahead after all, without getting distracted by pointless questions.
You arrived at the fortress's dam control room. According to the map found in the room, you should be able to get out from here.
It seems that Karl wasn't able to fully awaken the demonic power within himself. Perhaps he still has some doubts...
If Karl is still uncertain, you know what you need to do. Eliminate the threats of the demons and Karna Masta, and save Tilith.
You leave the plaza and find yourself on the main street. Across the bridge ahead is the gate to the outskirts of town. Liomerg is probably there.
Apparently, formidable foes await you on the bridge. You want to conserve your strength before fighting Liomerg, but that may be impossible.
Liomerg stands before the gate. You don't see Karl, but he's probably watching. You can't embarrass yourself now.
This isn't your first fight with Lugina. But he says he'll show you a new power he had kept hidden, so this won't go like the last time.
You're advancing across a gigantic spider's web. The thick threads are stable, but watch your step. Especially since you're up against Lugina.
Lose your footing and you'll fall into the depths. It seems like there's water down there, but this is Ishgria. You won't come out unscathed.
Lugina's fighting spirit... That feeling you get when you face a formidable foe... You need to get serious, before Lugina summons his true strength.
You see Lugina laughing as though he's invincible. He has the advantage no matter where you approach from. Be careful, and give it your all!
As expected, it's difficult to talk with demons. But they might be more cooperative if you demonstrate your power?
You head for the summit, defeating one enemy after another. You start to wonder if demons are only capable of understanding others through combat.
You approach the midpoint of the mountain trail. Ahead, at the peak, you can sense a presence so powerful it stifles your spirit. Is it a dragon?
A gate capable of moving Karna Masta, seal and all... But you're worried that a power on that level just might break the seal.
You see Liomerg on the final incline before the peak. This is probably the end of the line. Get ready for a decisive battle!
Only the demon Barion remains. If you can't win here, it would be foolish to face Karna Masta. It's time to show your power!
You have to face the demon Kalon's Shadow alongside Lugina. The true seal on Karna Masta should break soon as well. The time to fight draws near.
It's been a long time since you fought with Paris. She wants to fight to overcome her doubts. With that in mind, you want to give your all.
Mora states her goal is to unify the world and end all conflict. But she is a demon, too. For that reason alone she won't avoid friction.
Mora didn't come out and say it, but she wants help. Even so, everyone is resolved. They can't accede to her ambitions.
It seems this facility pumps up oil from beneath the sea floor. A lot of devices made with otherworldly technologies use this oil.
Some of the oil that is pumped up is burned to remove impurities. That is why this facility belches forth flames endlessly.
Clouds of black, poisonous smoke stand in your way. You want to hurry ahead to the snowy plains after Mora, but the enemies in your way come first.
Your allies seem alright. Rescue can wait; focus on fighting Mora. Your fate was to face her. Hopefully this will be the last time for it, though.
You must assemble demonic powers to face Karna Masta. That means that if Mora wasn't lying, you'll need her help.
A raging wind chills you to the bone, and drowns out the sound of your footsteps. All you can see is white, and you still have a long way to go.
You can barely keep to the path due to the blizzard. But you won't lose sight of your goal. Advance without wavering, so you can rescue Tilith.
All you can do is focus on advancing as you push through deep snowdrifts. Suddenly a fierce wind springs up, and the blizzard intensifies.
You were finally released from the blizzard's abuse thanks to your arrival in the frozen woods. But the cold is unchanged, and your hands are numb.
It feels as though time itself has frozen in the silence of these woods. You let out a deep sigh, and continue to advance steadily.
Snow falls through the gaps between trees. Sometimes, a clump falls from the branches noisily, startling you by sounding like an enemy's approach.
The white snow and dark trees deceive your eyes. Deep snowdrifts entangle your legs. Protracted fighting here is harder than you imagined.
The trees have thinned out. You are almost out of the woods, and you miss warmer lands. Hopefully somewhere more sheltered is coming up next.
There is a gate of appropriate size for the immense valley it blocks off built across the precipice. It seems to be mechanical.
A single path extends toward the mechanical gate. It seems you will have to fight Shusui here after all. Prepare yourself.
There's something weird and mechanical on the path. Could it be a device for transferring power generated at the oil well?
While it's better than the plains or the woods, it's still cold here. It's so cold that you're almost eager to fight with Shusui already.
Is Shusui covered in wounds from his battle with Owen? Or was it one of Mora's traps? Either way, you can't hold back against him.
You are finally free of the cold. Truthfully, it's cold here too, but still so much warmer than you have been for a while. You feel alive again.
You're inside a cave, but its walls of transparent ice let the outside light shine in. It reflects off every surface, eliminating all shadows.
Sound reverberates in the cave just as light reflects. Your footsteps echo many times over, and it sounds almost like you're leading a small army.
You emerged into a spacious cavern. The refracted light is concentrated here, and some of the ice is melted. It's also a bit warm, thankfully.
Your eyes are growing tired, possibly because of the shining cave. They're also dry, and your vision is blurry. Getting attacked now would be risky.
Lugina said Karl's kindness was weakness. So what is strength? In all its grandeur, nature gives no answer.
A vicious, howling wind rolls over the side of the cliffs. Your body is stripped of all the warmth it accumulated within the cave in an instant.
You climb the path that juts out from the ice wall. At each crossroads you come across you must choose the safest-looking one from many options.
You should arrive at the castle where Mora awaits once you make it up this cliff. Looking up or down is terrifying, but you just have to keep going.
You've gotten close to the top. If you lose your footing here you're finished, yet your enemies fight without concern for the location. Be careful.
You proceed down the path that Lugina and Seria cleared as they went ahead. But then enemies appeared, as though they were waiting. It's an ambush.
This former stronghold of a demon leader is as elegant and impressive as you would expect. Even long years later, that hasn't changed.
It's said that the demons fell into an era of chaotic war after their leader left. It would appear this castle's purpose was lost afterwards, as well.
The two Summoners of Old are here, as are Bertz and Liomerg. The key will probably be whoever finds Mora first.
Apparently, this castle's original master had un-demonly dreams of eliminating conflict. Mora said she was taking up that quest, but...
Alongside Seria, you challenge Mora. Having absorbed the other demons, Mora is much stronger than ever before. Don't hold back!
Postpone your happiness for reuniting with Tilith and defeat Mora! Now is your chance, while her power is out of control!
Face Seria's feelings, and give this battle your all. It will help your friend find her own path.
Barion shows his true power and form. Face him alongside Karl, whose demonic powers have awakened! The answer Karl seeks must lie ahead.
It seems Kalon knows who lies ahead. But no matter what foe awaits, you must defeat the Holy Emperor with Tilith.
The blazing gate opens, scorching the very air. Under cover of billowing smoke, countless enemies have poured forth. Don't let them slow you down.
Hellish flames roar all around. You must conserve your strength as you dispatch the approaching foes. The path looks longer than anticipated.
As you clear the gate, the heat fades, but the onslaught intensifies. Behind you, enemy reinforcements leap down from above the gate.
Enemy resistance has subsided. One last group blocks your way. Dispatch them, and you can finally escape the influence of the Eight Sealed Gods' Gate.
Boiling water gushes from deep within the earth, and falls on you like scalding rain. But you must focus on the enemies at hand.
As Lugina suggests, the lack of resistance so far is perplexing. You should seize the chance to press forward.
The craggy ground is slick with mud, and dotted with sinkholes connected by fierce streams. This footing is every soldier's worst nightmare.
Rock crumbles underfoot, unleashing a jet of scalding water and nearly sending you sprawling. The slightest misstep could cost your life.
The expanse of countless hazardous geysers finally nears its end. An ominous feeling grows, as you realize it won't continue to be this easy...
The end of summoning arts? With the final battle impending, you have no time to consider the ramifications. But, it remains at the back of your mind.
All around you lie mercilessly crushed ruins, now covered with young forest. The foreboding silence tempts the mind to wander.
Moment by moment, the final battle draws near. How can you hope to overcome the might of the Holy Emperor, who overshadowed even the Summoners of Old?
Amidst the deep green, you exhale deeply. At your side are Tilith and your companions. Lament will only sap your resolve. It's time to move on.
Bertz's words seep into your heart like poison. But if you can't shake off something like this, you'll never stand a chance against the Holy Emperor.
The demon Kalon has watched over the seals of many lands. This must be a trial to gauge your worthiness. Show your strength!
Karna Masta defeated even the Summoners of Old, but with the Oracle Maiden's power, you can challenge him. You must hold on to even the faintest hope.
This place has been so utterly ravaged that its original purpose is a mystery. Such is the power of the Holy Emperor...
The broken ground makes for treacherous footing, but just brushing the surroundings with your hand could blast you with electricity. Be cautious.
Some of the surrounding wreckage is relatively intact. You marvel at the unfamiliar materials and workmanship. Could these be otherworldly relics?
Ark will attack with everything he has. Remain steadfast as you face him, and convince him to aid your cause.
You have never seen such a peaceful expression as on Ark's face. You silently gaze upon the gentle, yet sad countenance.
You have at last reached the heart of the brilliantly shining structure. This area is also heavily damaged, leaving you to wonder what it once was.
This must have once been a very important location. Some massive power lingers here, throwing off dazzling flashes of light.
As your eyes adjust to the light, you find your way outside the structure. The sudden plunge into blackness leaves you disoriented and vulnerable.
You emerge in a place defying description. It must be the ruins of a city...but nothing makes sense. So this is how this other world looks.
Cutting through a maze of alleys, you find yourself indoors, then underground. You wonder how the inhabitants avoided losing their way.
The cities filled with otherworldly technology you have seen before were filled with light, but this place becomes darker with each step.
Lights flicker here and there, but only make it more difficult to peer into the shadows. Before your eyes can adjust, you press on ahead.
On the outskirts of town, you feel a familiar air of destitution and desperation. You suppose the bad areas are not much different in any world.
You have finally reached the place where the Holy Emperor Karna Masta was sealed. Make haste to find Ilia's power for the remaining Summoners of Old.
Parting the thick mist, you search for any sign of Ilia. You feel the overpowering aura of a mighty god, but can find no trace of the Oracle Maiden.
You must buy time while Ark awakens Ilia's power. You may be in over your head...but you know you can count on your companions.
Were it not for the timely arrival of your companions, all would be lost. But now you must regain your strength. Believe in your friends.
Ilia and Tilith have merged their powers, opening a route to strike down Karna Masta. The Summoner pours everything they have into the final battle!
The Holy Emperor's physical form has been annihilated. However, two seals remain. As the Summoner searches for the secret, who should appear but...
The Summoners arrive in Mildran, where Karna Masta's soul is imprisoned. Who could be waiting for them in these lands?
Mildran, the former home of great royalty. The ruins still visible in the thin fog remind you of those long-gone days of luxury.
There are those who came to this place of their own will, to face the past. But the "Rejecting Seal" gives them second thoughts.
Amidst the falling ash, you eventually reach something like a town center. Many months and years of history lay in ruins all around you.
Wordlessly you progress through the lonely scene. What areas of this capital would most interest Paris if she were here?
As you progress through the capital, Ark's demeanor seems to grow more serious. Perhaps he senses something waiting ahead.
Waiting in the floating castle was a black mass of residual energy and the wandering souls of heroes. Ark steps forward alone for this fated battle!
Ark has reconfirmed his strength after defeating the Six Heroes. Along with the Summoner, he moves forward towards his goal anew.
The story of a hero toyed with by the gods to bring back a loved one. In the end will he find hope, or despair...?
With Karna Masta totally defeated, Ark is free to be with Ilia, now released from her seal. Yet, his worries haven't dissipated...
Welcome to the newly discovered realm of Cordelica. A huge gate towers above you, as if it were beckoning Summoners inside...
Beyond the huge gate unfolds a fiery cave. It doesn’t look like you’ll find anything worthy of investigation here, so keep moving forward.
You’ve stumbled into a thriving monster habitat. Judging by the hungry glint in their eyes, you’re probably the first human they’ve seen in centuries.
There’s no respite from the scalding heat. A gust of hot wind blasting through the maze of caverns.
A cold wind dries the sweat from your forehead. Could the exit be nearby? You spot a shaft of light, but it’s guarded by a formidable-looking foe...
You exit the infernal cave and come upon a huge waterfall spanned by a breathtaking rainbow. Finally, some beautiful scenery to soothe your weary soul.
A monster ambush interrupts your reverie with the scenery. Dispose of them and continue with your investigation.
You pass behind the cascading waterfall and continue to the next area. Lugina’s warning plays in your mind, but you’re too curious to turn back now.
The roar of the waterfall cascading around you drowns out the sound of approaching demons. They lurk in the water and shadows, waiting for their moment to pounce.
Just as you’re about to exit on the other side of Ignia Falls, a watery monarch emerges from behind the waterfall. He’s come to expel the intruders in his domain...
On the other side of the huge waterfall a vast forest stretches as far as the eye can see. According to Lugina, the monsters here are the most dangerous you’ve faced.
The overgrown foliage deep inside the forest is maze-like in its complexity. What lies on the other side?
Even after the world has been reduced to rubble, the souls of bandits continue to exist deep within the forest. They target travelers’ valuables, just like when they were alive.
The bandits tell of a dragon who protects all the trees in the forest. Could that be where this distant roar is coming from?
A massive tree stretches into the heavens from the center of the forest. There's no chance of passing through the forest's twisting maze without its blessing.
Do as Lugina says and defeat the hordes of monsters dwelling within the fortress. You’ll be able to continue with your investigation afterwards.
Scores of monsters block your path forward, but there’s no turning back now. Show them who’s boss by attacking them head-on.
You break through the frontal defenses only to find yourself ambushed yet again, but this time from above! Time to quiet this raging beast.
Two monstrous birds, more ferocious than anything else you’ve encountered, lie in wait to stop the advance of any would-be intruders into their territory.
Danger awaits you in the great courtyard at the center of Valtan Fortress. Defeat whatever it is to complete Lugina's mission.
You arrive at the Tower of Light hot on the heels of Lugina and Paris. Could the mystery of Cordelica really lie within its radiant and lofty walls?
The roar of an ancient dragon reverberates inside the walls of the tower. Only those able to conquer their fear are worthy of scaling the tower’s heights.
The higher you climb, the tougher the monsters seem to get. Amid all the chaos, the sound of a beautiful and bewitching singing voice beckons you ever higher.
Nothing poses a greater threat to Summoners than monsters of opposite elements cooperating to launch a combination attack. Fire and water, for instance...
Countless monsters appear as if to drive the intruders from their hallowed tower. But what are they protecting? Part of Cordelica's past, or some other hidden truth?
As the fight continues to escalate, the sound of gunfire mixed in with the roar of monsters hints at even more danger to come. Could Lugina have found something?
An overwhelming presence emanates from the top of the tower. Could it be the legendary power bestowed upon those who’ve heard the voice of the gods?
A mine shaft winds its way in the direction of the Giant's Ruins. Monsters fond of the dank conditions lurk in the shadows, their fangs occasionally glinting in the darkness.
Spots of nature continue to exist even in this most man-made of environments. Unfortunately, nature isn’t always man’s ally...
The dark mineshaft continues to beckon weary travelers deeper inside its murky maw. Monsters can smell fear, so whatever you do, beware your sweet scent.
You emerge from what you thought was a never-ending tunnel to be greeted by a bright light, only to find out the light was actually a flash of lightning.
An evil air pervades the pitch-blackness of the mine’s innermost reaches. Exhausted by their travails, despair nibbles at the heart of any weary traveler on this road.
A glimmer of hope crosses your mind as you feel the route slowly ascending, though the air of death continues to loom about in the shadows around you.
A faint light glimmers at the end of what seemed like never-ending darkness. Standing before it, a nightmarish monster rears its head, revealing a bewitching smile.
You come to some vast and ancient ruins, cloaked in an air of solemnity. The time of Cordelica’s reckoning is soon at hand. Prepare yourself for the battle ahead.
You follow Lugina’s orders and launch yourself into the path of the marauding monsters. You have to give it all you've got on the front lines!
As if drawn by the heat of battle, monsters from far and wide descend upon your position. You can’t afford to rest until Lugina has defeated Grantos!
Locked in the throes of battle, a strange sensation overcomes you momentarily. You don’t know what caused it, but you decide to track its source...
The carvings here are even more ornate than those near the entrance of the ruins. A fresh gash runs horizontally across one of the giant frescoes. What could've done this?
Continuing deeper into the ruins in search of the strange sensation’s source, you come across souls driven mad mad by anger. What could have done this?
The source of the strange sensation is revealed in a legendary giants with powers rivaling those of the gods. Do you run, or stay and fight?
After defeating the giants, you now face the toughest challenge of all in their king, Grantos. The final showdown to determine the fate of Cordelica is about to begin.
There's a cavern just behind the Ignia Falls. A mysterious beast has awaken deep inside, seemingly disturbed by your battle with the giants. What could it be?
Now you can't rely on anything else but your own physical power. And although Tilith may be helping, you should stay alert.
Even surrounded by enemies, at least you were able to meet with Lugina's subordinate, Reda. Watch how she fights.
This is what it is to fight for yourself, feeling the resistance through your weapons. You can see how much you've depended on Summoning until now.
A bizarre scene of machines making machines unfolds before you. They make machines in Elgaia, too, but there is no comparison in scale.
Machines are everywhere you look. There's no sign of any people. Could this be related to the collapse Reda spoke of?
You've gotten used to fighting without Summoning. Even so, it might not go well if you run into a powerful enemy as you are now.
You've won the trust of a strange automaton. Your goal keeps moving further away. You've got to fight through swarming enemies to get there.
The land around you is covered in broken machines, and the sharp debris makes for bad footing. You have to hurry or you'll lose sight of your goal.
Your target has slowed down. You're almost there. You've grown confident in your fighting skills, so now it's time to close the gap.
Your target has stopped moving. However, you sense a powerful feeling of malice close by. You won't be able to avoid a difficult fight.
Hatch and Tull, you've picked up some unexpected companions on your journey. More importantly, these automatons seem oddly human.
You proceed into the tower made of geometric crystal and metal. It looks like it was built for people to live in, but there's no sign of anyone.
According to Hatch and Tull, humans vanished from this world long ago. Yet the city seems to be perfectly preserved...
There are some mechanical experts and actual machines among those you can Summon, but are any of them connected to this world?
Leaving Mersas, you're finally almost at the Information Tower. It would be nice if you could get there without trouble, but...
You made it to the Information Tower, your present goal. You're able to use Summoning again for whatever reason, so you might as well start climbing.
You've gotten used to fighting for yourself alongside Summoning. You feel like you've grown to understand why Karl and Seria fight this way.
There's probably a device you can get information from on the top floor, but before that a powerful enemy you must fight awaits.
You probably shouldn't be surprised, but it seems Bertz made it to this world first. Reda doesn't even need to tell you that you have to hurry.
This wasteland is wildly different from the rest of Bectas. Is this an area they've extracted ores from in order to make machines?
You can see a building past the wasteland. That's probably your destination. What is the being that protects this world? Does this world have gods?
You feel something unpleasant, but it's not malice. Is it a premonition? Watch for dangerous enemies near the building as you advance.
As expected, the building was full of machines. It also seems to be full of enemies. Be careful, you don't know what else awaits you.
Massive numbers of machines are attacking. It's exhausting and there's no end in sight. Reda appears to be sick of it, too.
Hatch and Tull seem to have told the truth about lacking combat abilities. Maybe this would have been easier if they could fight with you...
You hear an unnatural sound that you recognize. It seems a formidable foe you've fought many times awaits you. Take up your weapon and move forward.
You've arrived at the central block. Find the being that protects Bectas, and your mission is complete. Yet you feel like you're forgetting something.
Lugina breaks through a wall and appears. You don't have time to ask questions. For now, defeat the massive automaton he called the "Divine Machine"!
You've arrived at the building Reda discovered and was set on exploring. This place is clearly different from the other buildings on Bectas.
The old castle ringed with a half-frozen lake like a moat makes you think of scenes from Grand Gaia. Who could possibly live here?
You can see the castle more clearly as you approach, and it really does seem similar to some ruins you've seen before.
Did the culture of this world influence Grand Gaia just as the one on Bectas did? Or was it Grand Gaia that influenced this world?
The gate is right ahead of you. You can tell now that you're close. You're pretty sure you've seen extremely similar architecture on Grand Gaia...
You were shocked to learn that humans fled to places other than Elgaia during the war with the gods. Are there other cases of this, as well?
Fearing attack by the Mystical Wolf's minions, the townsfolk keep their doors shut tight. And thus the town itself is overrun with monsters.
The Mystical Wolf's change is probably related to this land's sealed god. If so, your survey will probably also help to save this world's people.
Luciana has moved ahead despite Liana's effort to stop her. It seems our presence has had negative effects. You have to catch up to her.
Luciana believes the legends, and probably thinks the gods are still humanity's enemies. Liana seems terrified of Tilith, too.
According to Liana, it's not especially cold right now. This is the normal weather all year. Elgaia might seem like a paradise next to this world.
The snow on the trees sometimes falls to the ground noisily. How did the people of this world survive in such a cold land?
The three of you proceed along the lake's shore. The lake is frozen in patches, and it seems like a person could walk out onto the ice in some places.
There was no snow in Tull's world, so advancing through it is a real struggle. You have to walk ahead and pack down the snow.
The problem with this world is the enemies that hide in the snow and leap out at you. If you get thrown into the lake, you might even die of the cold.
You're almost to the site of one of the shrines. However, you're well aware from experience that "almost there" is a dangerous place to be.
There's a fantastical scene unfolding in the sky. You want to observe closely, but there's no time if you intend to catch up to Luciana.
These snowfields seem to be filled with lurking enemies, but with Hatch scouting ahead you should still be able to avoid most fights.
You can see far across the vast snowfields, but the enemies hide in the snow and ambush you at times. Stay alert for their presence as you advance.
You're close to the border between the snowfields and the ice lake. Powerful enemies often lie in wait in places like this. Keep your wits about you.
The sealed god of this land appears from nowhere. Beat it and you'll complete your mission here. All you can do now is fight with all you have!
It seems that the Mystical Wolf was actually this world's sealed god. You need to find a way to win before you fight it again...
The cold, dry air makes your nose hurt. Reda seems to be freezing, too, but Luciana and Liana appear used to it.
Enemies attack frequently, but at least it warms you up a bit. It might be nice to fight for yourself under these circumstances.
The air has shifted. There must be an exit nearby. The sisters say that it's still quite a ways to the polar regions even after you leave this cave.
You can't let sudden meetings and attacks confuse you. They attacked after determining you were a Summoner of the Summoners' Hall, which must mean...
The Abel Faction was ahead of you in this world, too. How much information are they getting before the Summoners' Hall does?
You can't tell how deep the cracks in the massive ice blocks go. All you can do is take extreme care in where you step as you advance.
Cold air...no, a presence so tense it hurts. This alone tells you the immense power of the sealed god. Just what is this sealed god?
Although you're fairly used to it by now, things are still harder when your Summoning is restricted. You have to get stronger.
You restored the power of Summoning on Bectas by fighting the sealed god. Will that happen again if you fight the mystical wolf?
The frequency of enemy attacks has changed... You have a bad feeling about this. You could be wrong, but it feels like you're being chased somewhere.
It seems the Mystical Wolf's minions have surrounded the area, but you can't let yourself lose for Luciana and Liana's sakes!
Rene calls you deep underground, beneath the lake castle. Once inside, you experience a sense of deja vu recalling Bariura in Grand Gaia.
You see something unexpected as you progress deep into the polar region. It's shocking to see a place so verdant in this snowbound world.
The sun is warm, and the winds are gentle. The climate near here seems nice. Even the leaves make a pleasant sound.
You see a band of people in black chasing a woman. You don't understand the situation, but she's clearly in danger!
Who were those people in black? They might attack again, so you need to get somewhere with better visibility.
You've heard of warriors called shinobi. Does that mean someone from Ohbanahara became a Grand Gaian hero?
Seria's decision caught you off guard. She must be growing up. You can't let her show you up, though.
You're going to help Suzune reclaim the country, but that will probably take more than civil discussions to achieve. Be ready to fight.
The watery fields around you are apparently called paddies, and they're strangely beautiful when they glisten in the sunlight.
You've seen many signs of wartime destruction already, but this is the first time you've seen the site of a battle that was only days old...
Broken swords, shattered armor... You should probably stop looking so closely at the things around you. Suzune's looking pale, too.
Sakunoshin said that people who dress and cover their faces like the one you just passed are called begging monks. They dress very suspiciously.
Apparently there's a checkpoint and a city once you get past Calamity Plains. Maybe you should dress like you're from this world to get through it?
Sakunoshin is unconscious, but you can't leave him behind. For now, try to focus your attacks on the enemy leader and make an opening!
You got free thanks to the begging monk. If he's helping you, he's probably an ally of Suzune's. Trust him for now and focus on escaping.
You doubt that the enemy will risk harming Suzune, but you're not sure. You have to escape this castle as soon as possible!
There's a river down the hill and past the checkpoint. The large bridge over it that seems to lead to a city, and the castle lies just beyond.
You're fascinated by this culture so unlike that of Elgaia, but you need to hurry to Suzune's rescue. You'll have time for sightseeing later.
Genba's minions are in position on the bridge, and it won't be easy to get across. You need to hurry and push through it.
You come to a sudden stop when you sense a powerful foe. You may have been too hasty in this. You need to calm down and stay centered as you fight.
As expected, you've run into a skilled warrior. But why does this warrior know about the sealed god? You'll have to fight to find out.
There are too many enemies to count! They did know you were coming, so it's not shocking. All you can do is fight your way through.
You dash through the chaotic melee, crushing autumn leaves as you go. Get into the castle while the begging monk keeps Kagenui busy!
You've finally gotten through the maze-like castle walls to the main building. Now you can charge the entrance that Sakunoshin mentioned.
You're surprised that the floors are soft. It seems like all of the flooring is made of woven leaves. You notice that Sakunoshin is going barefoot.
The castle doesn't seem to be that big inside. That makes it easy to explore, but the low ceilings make it hard to swing heavy weapons.
You rush up the steps for a higher floor. The creaking of the stairways informs you that the castle is made of wood.
Kagenui has caught up to you from behind, and Genba, the enemy leader, is right ahead. But if you make it through this fight, Suzune will be safe.
Sakunoshin saved your life. That Phoenix Strike is terrifying, but it won't be so easy to use with Sakunoshin around.
You proceed over a roof made of bizarre tiles. You're so high up you couldn't help but look down. There's no coming back if you fall.
You've made it far enough to see Raka, but you face more foes than ever. Seria's eyes tell you that she'll handle it, so you keep heading up.
You don't have time to wait on Seria, so you'll be facing Raka alone. It seems she won't use her Phoenix Strike, but she's too strong to take lightly.
This should be your last fight in the castle. You can sense more power from the Mystical Phoenix than any other sealed god so far. Give it your all!
Suzune has asked you to investigate a monster with Kagenui. Sakunoshin also came along for some reason. Will that cause problems?
Myoukei gave you a letter. When you had Sakunoshin read it, it said to come to this field. What does this have to do with you?
The Abel Faction got here ahead of you, but supposedly you're among the first humans ever to set foot here. No one knows what to expect.
It seems you're on a vast, flat grassland, but there are stones scattered across the plains. You'll trip if you don't watch your step.
Despite the excellent visibility, the footing is poor. It's not a great place to fight, but at least the climate is better than some you've endured.
A gentle breeze stirs the grass at your feet. The birds in the sky seem like they're enjoying it, too. Wait... Are those really birds?
There's more rubble at your feet now, and you can see a building somewhere far off. Dangerous enemies are often found lurking in areas like this...
You hide from the magical puppets amid the shadows of the ruins. You don't know what the puppets were made for, but they seem to be combat-ready.
The ruins nearby are obviously too large to have been for human use. But why are they half-destroyed? Was there a battle here?
The temperature is still nice, but it's very dark inside the massive ruins. It feels even darker given the light outside, and your eyes won't adapt.
You've been discovered by the magical puppets. Judging by their response, they don't mean to let you get away. It looks like you'll have to fight.
You managed to escape from the puppets and arrived at a flooded sector. This section of the ruins looks even more degraded than the others.
Once you get through the building with water up to your waist, you find yourself walking on muddy ground. You don't want to spend very long here.
The ruins are a jumble, and there are several paths through them. Maybe one of them was easy to use once. You just want dry ground to walk on.
You agreed to work with the Abel Faction in order to defeat the magical puppets. The plan is to form three teams of two and surround the puppets.
Just as Reda said, the way past here seems rather difficult. Still, the magical puppets will catch you if you stop to complain.
You attempt the challenging climb carefully. You don't sense anyone ahead of you. Did those two from the Abel Faction find another route?
You stretch out to grab a stone, then search for footing amid the waterfall's spray. It's slippery, and you watch each other as you climb.
Your almost-submerged waterfall climb is finally at an end. It's a major accomplishment, but you feel like there had to have been an easier route.
You reunite with Grahdens and advance along a sheer cliffside route. It's still extremely dangerous, but much easier than the waterfall climb.
You advance carefully along the narrowing red cliff route. Reda sometimes takes stone samples from the cliff walls; maybe they're unique to Rokkzalm?
As you face off against the Abel Faction, more enchanted puppets suddenly enter the fray. You'll have to handle them if you're going after Rahnas!
You're concerned about Bertz and Lugina, but you have to get back to the Sealed God mission. The cavernous temple before you is utterly silent.
Supposedly this world itself is a Sealed God, and apparently this temple is its center. You approach with caution as you seek the Sealed God's heart.
Since they're ahead of you, the Abel Faction has probably already reached this temple. Be careful, attacks could come from any direction.
This temple is clearly split into bright and dark locations, and it seems this was deliberate. Who, or what, could've built this place?
You felt someone watching you as you stepped into the temple's heart. Is this world itself watching you?
The atmosphere is solemn, and you can feel tension building with each step you take. It's definitely connected to whatever lies ahead.
Mel and Garrett are attempting to hold you back, and combat seems unavoidable. You have to eliminate them both and catch up with Rahnas right away!
You lost a lot of time fighting Mel and Garrett and now you have to hurry. Rahnas may have already reached the Sealed God's core.
It won't be easy to face Rahnas unless you can fully defeat the enchanted puppet. It's a powerful foe, but you can beat anything if you try!
You were investigating a Sealed God signal with Grahdens when magical puppets emerged from the ground. You've got to break their encirclement!
Look up and you'll see a myriad of stars twinkling in the blue sky even in the daytime, reflecting the many dragons flying overhead.
Bertz and the Abel Faction's objective is unclear, but as Karl says, one strategy may be to give priority to crushing their plans.
Looking up at the stars under a blue sky is also something you feel you could get used to. You may come back for stargazing once everything's done.
Red flickers are visible in the distance. Seems like it's time to say farewell to this hill of falling stars. Look sharp and let's move ahead.
The gods of Grand Gaia were surprised you came to this world, and perhaps not so surprisingly, you don't seem to be welcome. Prepare for a fight...
The seal of Alza Masta...the role of the Sealed Gods... Too many things have become obvious. It might pay to reassess all the information.
You make your way along a fire lit path. The power a Summoner needs to subdue the Pious Emperor Alza Masta...naturally you can't hide your shock.
If you lack focus, you'll risk falling into a grave of scorching flames. Forget about the conversation a moment ago and concentrate on the battle.
You have come close to the foot of a mountain that emits lightning. You turn to the Dragon's Flame Tomb and feel a strong heat approaching...
Lugina appeared to be a little stressed. Perhaps he can see ahead to what will happen if he can't stop Bertz.
Amidst the flashes of light and resounding thunder, in this place you're no longer able to think of anything other than the Dragon's Flame Tomb.
As usual it was impossible to know what Bertz was thinking. It may be your imagination, but there looked to be benevolence in his eyes.
A rumbling sound fills your ears. It's not thunder, this seems to be a roar. A battle with the owner of that voice may be unavoidable.
A fantastic light is being reflected off the peaceful surface of the lake. This is a place where you want to take your time and enjoy the scenery.
Not a ripple stirs on the surface, and the view of the surrounding scenery reflected in the water is tranquility itself.
It's quiet, peaceful...you calm down more than necessary. This won't do. You need to stay alert in case of an enemy attack.
What Bertz was after...and Rahnas's past. There's no point dwelling on it. Your first priority is to prevent Rahnas from getting hold of power.
Like the lake, this forest also makes you introspective. It's clear what you need to do now. Stop thinking about unnecessary things.
Going along this dark trail for some reason makes you recall the paths you've traveled so far. When you think about it, you've traveled many places.
This forest doesn't have an especially strange atmosphere, yet it feels like you've come to a very faraway place...
While walking through the forest, you recall your adventures so far and become lost in thought. You need to focus on the battle awaiting you.
Once you've passed through the forest, a majestic temple-like structure appears before you. Could it be something that the gods of Grand Gaia created?
The temple has comparatively little damage and is well maintained. Maybe those two gods you encountered in this world are taking care of it?
You didn't expect to come across two Elder Summoners fighting Rahnas! Owen probably won't like it, but back him up as Grahdens instructs.
Rahnas was an even stronger opponent than you imagined. However, Owen's strength seemed to be slightly superior. If you fight now, you might win.
No one could hide their surprise at Owen taking a severe wound. He's been treated now, but you can't help but feel the scope of Rahnas's power.
If Rahnas gains true Summoning power, what does he intend to do with it? Bertz said he wanted to protect Elgaia, but...
You've let your mind wander again, and that won't do. Clear your head and fix your attention on the battle happening right in front of you.
You've only just now noticed the beauty of this cave. With so much on your mind you're beginning to get tunnel vision. Stay alert.
You have the uneasy feeling you're being watched from the darkness. To get through the cave, probably your only option is to defeat a powerful foe.
The power left behind after the Holy Emperor battled Ark in Ishgria lies deep within this place. You don't feel any aggression yet, but...
You've stopped the Sealed Gods from going berserk on many other worlds. Here that journey will likely come to an end. Just focus on what you must do.
Rahnas is one step ahead of you. If your power is stolen, a painful battle most likely awaits you. You have to stop him before that can happen!
Rahnas has gained Karna Masta's power and it's formidable! But remember your battles in Grand Gaia and Ishgria, and seize victory once again!
The story of the Summoner who continued to fight alongside a goddess gives people hope. You can't let them down in this battle!
The two gods who were cooperative until now have challenged you to a fight. Best to just comply with whatever is necessary for them to move forward.
You didn't expect to come up against Alza Masta again... Could this be the fated outcome of gaining Karna Masta's power...?
The mission this time is to pursue Mel and Garrett. You never thought that would mean traveling all over Elgaia with Tilith.
You meet Lugina and proceed into a barren grassland. You never knew there were parts of Elgaia like this. What happened here?
This is a complete wasteland. It looks as though some massive power once shattered the land. The damage doesn't seem that old, though...
You thought you knew everything about Elgaia, but it seems this journey will be as hard as the rest. Get ready to face a formidable foe.
Mel and Garrett are ready for a fight to the end. You can't avoid fighting, even if just to back them off. It's not the first time, but be careful!
Neither Mel nor Garrett, nor even Bertz would listen to you. There really shouldn't have been any need for combat.
The area around you is devastated. Lugina said it wasn't due to the demons of Ishgria. But if it wasn't demons, what was it?
You can't allow the demon to go free. You have to get Mel to stop standing in your way somehow, and hurry after Garrett!
Mel is coming along complacently. You're glad you didn't have to restrain her, but her behavior seems a bit odd.
Perhaps it's because you weren't a great student, but you've never heard about any demons appearing here. The information may have been suppressed.
How many years will it be until this region is habitable once again? You must stop the demon's resurrection, at any cost.
According to Bertz, Mel is an artificially-created human. Yet you can't help but treat her as a person, and Tilith seems to approve.
You've seen countless ruins throughout Grand Gaia. Though it seems to have been a while since this place was destroyed, it still feels lively.
If the demon is revived, more places like this town will come to be. And in Elgaia, it will affect so many people!
You were shocked to learn that Lugina and Bertz were born in this region. Both probably have terrifying memories of the demon that destroyed it.
Bertz's desire to prevent another such tragedy is pure. For all that's happened, you can probably still reach an understanding with him.
You have to stop Garrett's plan no matter what. Countless people will be harmed if the demon awakens. You have to prevent that no matter what.
Mel says she intends to obey Garrett when he speaks of Rahnas's wishes. Did she choose to do so of her own accord?
Garrett laid his trap meticulously. All you can say is that you're impressed, given how badly injured he was when he set it up.
You sense a repulsive presence. It's definitely distinct from the other demons you've faced. You're probably close to where it's sealed; keep moving.
